text: SOUND: Someone breathing, GASPING for breath they're so afraid. And the HIGH-PITCHED WHINE of RAMJETS laboring against heavy side-winds as we struggle to focus on - - OPEN OCEAN. CHURNING, whipping past at a couple hundred miles an hour, 800 feet below a SOLDIER'S DANGLING BOOTS.

What am I doing here? PVT. BILLY CAGE is maybe 20. Too young for this. COLD SWE trickles into his eyes. When he tries to wipe it away, hi ARMORED FINGERS CLACK against clear ACRYLIC. His FACEPLAT Cage is wearing an EXOJACKET: powered, tight-fitting body armor, bristling with weaponry. TWO DOZEN OTHER young, terrified SOLDIERS hang with him, also jacketed, dangling over the OPEN BAY DOORS, over OCEAN. Cage taps a button. His faceplate opens, NOISE floods in DEAFENING ROAR. He rubs his eyes -
Don't poke yer eye out, bud. PVT. YONABURU, a hard-ass fuckup with Asian features but Southern drawl - Cage's battle-buddy - smiles.
FROM UP FRONT, BATTLE-SCARRED SGT. FARELL shoots them a l ACROSS from Cage, GRIFF, 25, a burly-looking bad-ass, kee making an about-to-vomit face, barely fighting back the u
PRIVATE GRIFF! Don't PUKE.
Yes sir! Griff's face twitches again. A female soldier, NANCE, gri

You spit up in yer jacket, you're in for a world a' shit. FORD, a jarhead dickweed proper, LAUGHS, missing a few te Now OIL from Cage's jacketed fingers streaks his face. Th faceplate sucks shut. FLOATING HEADS-UP READOUTS flicker
You OK there, buddy?
(trembling) Yeah.

We're gonna be fine. I got us life insurance. Mrs. Smith. Yonaburu taps "MRS. SMITH", an antiquated SMITH & WESSON -357, against his faceplate and slips it in his exojacket utility belt. Cage doesn't look too reassured.

DOZENS OF OTHER FB90 DROPSHIPS streak by; squarish, clums looking, like flying bricks, which is what everyone calls them. ARTILLERY FIRE STRAFES back and forth as - A DROPSHIP takes a HIT and is gone. FAR BELOW, a BEACH co into view, a red SQUARE superimposed on the HEADS-UP - THE DROP POINT. Cage shuts his eyes.
Oh God oh God oh God -
GO! GO! Go! The first SOLDIER hits a release and FALLS, tumbling. The ANOTHER. Then ANOTHER. YONABURU gives Cage the thumbs up
Yonaburu hits his RELEASE and -
- SOLDIERS LITTER OUT, tumbling like living ordinance. Yo think parachutes might open... but they don't.
CAGE CAN'T DO IT. SEVERAL OTHERS can't, either. ONE SOLD DANGLES by a jacketed hand like a kitten going to the vet Sgt. Farell KICKS the hand free and JUMPS himself -

(screeching) ..-TAKING FIRE UP HERE, WE GOTTA... KERWHAM! The dropship is STRUCK - TWICE. One of the hangi soldiers is TORN IN HALF, the pieces flying. FLAME belche through the DROPBAY and the ship LURCHES - Cage SCREAMS, HITS his release and -
The dropship ABOVE, in FLAMES, BURNING SOLDIERS falling, OTHERS clinging on as it SPINS OUT OF CONTROL. CAGE FALLS SCREAMING, his HEADS-UP flashing red, the ground RUSHING

- WHUMP! THUMP! FHUMP! SOLDIERS hit the beach, hard enoug leave CRATERS in the WET SAND. AND HERE COMES CAGE, SCREAMING, FLAILING, KICKING - at th last second his jacket goes into AUTOLAND; tiny JETS cush the fall just enough to not break any bones and... WHAM! Two seconds of ear-ringing silence. A GASP as Cage's lung refill, he staggers up, WET SAND falling from his facepla his HEADS-UP highlighting TERRAIN and FRIENDLIES - THREE OTHER SOLDIERS stagger up out of their own craters.

THE HAPPY SOLDIER smiles at Cage, and -— 12 TONS OF FLAMING DROPSHIP LAND ON THE HAPPY SOLDIER. Ca is THROWN BACK from the impact, landing in two feet of su Struggling back up, he sees - THE BROKEN DROPSHIP SPEWING FLAME, ANOTHER SOLDIER stuck under the ship, FLAILING as he dies. Cage stares in shock
I, uh, yeah - the ship, the ship...
Cage turns, seeing YONABURU with a FLOATING BLUE HEADS-UP FLAG superimposed above him. Cage blindly runs after him
TENS OF THOUSANDS OF OTHER JACKETED INFANTRY stream to th meetpoints, thick as ants, ARTILLERY STRAFING PAST THEM a
MORE DROPSHIPS THAN WE CAN COUNT and fast-moving STRIKEJE beyond them STREAK in loose formations into the horizon a

MASSIVE CARRIERS lob HEAVY ORDINANCE into the already bla coastline, pieces of SEA-CLIFF exploding. HALF A MILLION SOLDIERS are landing today in what can only be - HUMANITY'S LAST, BEST STAND... RUBY TUESDAY. It looks like D-Day meets Armageddon.

to join their company. It's hard to even walk in an exoja if you're not practiced in it, and they aren't. ON THEIR HEADS-UPS: Their TWO BLUE DOTS get closer to the cluster of OTHER BLUE DOTS as the first ENEMY FIRE starts streaking in, TEARING UP THE BEACH. THAP! THAP! CAGE JUMPS, YONABURU TOO -— - BOTH land badly, SCRAMBLE UP, catching a first GLIMPSE THOUSANDS OF ENEMY INFANTRY streaming down the cliffs but

head_text.subj: CAGE AND YONABURU TUMBLE INTO THE TRENCH

text: Falling in with the other terrified SOLDIERS, SGT. FARELL screaming to TAC-COM about where's his fucking air suppor Cage has two seconds to get his bearings before -
A RED DOT approaching the BLUE DOTS of his company. Then few more RED DOTS...
This isn't how it's supposed to be. This isn't... First Division was supposed to clean this up -
Cage watches in mounting horror as the heads-up shows FOU MORE PAIR. And then 20. And then... a WALL OF RED.
We're all gonna die.
Shut the fuck up!
Even the Sergeant can't hide his fear.

As the FIRST SOLDIER out of the trench jumps up, a PROJEC hits him, knocking him at CAGE'S FEET -— The PROJECTILE in the soldier's chest isn't of human orig It's streaked with silver, biomechanical, WRIGGLING. A MI "JAVELIN". And from where the thing flew - THE ON-RUSHING MIMIC HORDE. At first, you could mistake them for human infantry, but they're not. They are ALIEN KILLING MACHINES. They're ARMORED, SHARP, and BRISTLING with unidentifiable weaponry that seems to grow out of their bodies, like a nightmare version of the jacketed soldiers they're evolve kill. Parts are METAL, parts GLISTENING BIOMASS. MIMICS have no individuality, no emotion, purpose or existence other than the vicious removal of human life.

THE SOLDIERS FIRE into the RACING MASS. They might as wel firing BB-GUNS at an oncoming BUFFALO STAMPEDE. ANOTHER soldier, down the line, takes TWO JAVELIN HITS. H jacket starts SHAKING, JITTERBUGGING off his brainstem's death-throes, his autocannon FIRING wildly - MIMIC JAVELINS sweep the trench where Cage and Yonaburu to aim - THUP THUP THUP!
Soldiers start RUNNING. But Cage is FROZEN TO THE SPOT, trembling, unable to MOVE. Yonaburu SLIDES DOWN BESIDE HI

COME ON, CAGE! WE GOTTA -— - BLAM! A SECTION OF TRENCH COLLAPSES. The hail of sand and smoke clears just in time to see the rest of 3rd Platoon HAULING ASS UP THE BEACH. ON CAGE'S H UP, the LITTLE BLUE DOTS of their team head OFFSCREEN. CAGE AND YONABURU ARE TOTALLY CUT OFF.
Yonaburu slides into firing position - target numbering systems on OVERLOAD -
Jesus, here it comes. Cage lifts his weapon, shaking, trying to pick a target. useless. In two seconds, they're gonna be DEAD MEAT.
Oh god oh god oh god - A squelchy RADIO SCREECH -
...VALKYRIE ONE, this is CHIEF BREEDER. STRIKEJETS GOT A LOCK...

SLEEK U.D.F. STRIKEJETS, FOUR OF THEM, streak in low. MIM volley JAVELIN as the sleek aircraft swing in for bombing ONE STRIKEJET takes a hit and tumbles, FLAMING, the PILOT SCREAMING as he spins, PLOWING INTO the MIMIC FRONT LINE. .-. but then the OTHER STRIKEJETS deliver their payloads. KATHOOM! A WALL OF FLAME goes up, the ground SHAKING fro impact. SMOKING, TWITCHING FRAGMENTS of MIMIC RAIN DOWN -

WHAM! WHAM! WHAM! THREE BIG, JACKETED SOLDIERS land, SMOO ROLLING into 3-point fighting position. This is DOG COMPA DOG COMPANY SOLDIERS are different. Their exojackets are blackened, dented, tricked out with graffiti, decals from countries they've fought in. Their grim faces are scarred Not a one of them stands under 6'4".
Eat ‘em up, boys. The Dogs' MASSIVE SHOULDER ROCKETS OPEN FIRE, 20mm, 50mm cannons nailing MIMICS right and left -
Holy shit! CAGE'S EYES GO WIDE and the WORLD GOES SLOW as -
AKA "VALKYRIE ONE", AKA "THE FULL METAL BITCH", LEAPS, fl

head_text.subj: RIGHT OVER CAGE AND YONABURU'S HEADS -

text: Her sleek exojacket is painted BLOOD RED. It's bare of weaponry except for - her TUNGSTEN CARBIDE BATTLE AXE. Al comically HUGE, nearly as big and certainly as heavy as s is. Good for one thing: BISECTING MIMICS. The axe SWINGS and four MIMICS are converted to eight TWITCHING HEAPS. She rolls into a PERFECT BATTLE STANCE. Her face; beautiful, battle-ready, and deadly calm -
Take me to your leader. - and with a collective YELL, the rest of DOG COMPANY fol her STRAIGHT INTO THE MIMIC FRONT LINE. Yonaburu JUMPS UP
It's RITA! THE FULL METAL BITCH! Come on, man, we gotta - But Cage is running across the sand. DESERTING.

Worse yet, TWO MIMIC RUNNERS have detached and GIVE CHAS YONABURU FIRES, taking one down, but the other is closing He looks back, to where RITA and the DOGS mercilessly eng the mimic in a ballet of precision fighting. He'd join, b
Fuck. Yonaburu takes off after Cage as - - Cage BLINDLY HAULS ASS for the SEA CLIFFS, scrambling u rocky bluff. Yonaburu catches up -
We have to get back to the unit! - and GRABS Cage's leg. Cage KICKS, FLAILING -
We won't make it! They're all DEAD!
They shoot deserters!
I don't care! LET ME GO! Cage CRAWLS, DRAGGING YONABURU to the CREST OF THE CLIFF.
Yonaburu stands, HEAVING BACK on CAGE'S LEG, and -— SHUP! HALF OF YONABURU'S head disappears in a shattering red, the broken shell of his faceplate smoking.
Yonaburu's jacket twitches, shudders, goes limp - and fal

Cage tries to stand, but Yonaburu's hand is still grippin his ankle. He twists, scrambling up - CAGE SEES WHAT SHOT YONABURU. The cliff's crest is a NEST OF MIMIC SCOUTS. SEVEN of the Only a little less surprised than Cage. Before he knows what he's doing, he's got TARGET-LOCK. C FIRES BLINDLY, the shock of his forearm cannon SPINNING h around in an arc - TAKTAKTAKTAKTAK! SEVERAL MIMICS GO DOWN, Cage FALLS on hi ASS, just missing the swings of BLADED MIMIC ARMS - - and he's STILL FIRING, into MIMIC LEGS, WHIPPING them d to the ground. No one has ever fought worse - or been as lucky - as Cage at this moment. In 2.3 seconds, SIX DEAD MIMIC lie twitching around him. Cage SCOOTS back, seeing - THE LAST MIMIC on the rise, getting ready to FIRE. He SHOOTS it. But with a CHITTERING, BUZZING NOISE, a FRE BIRTHED JAVELIN erupts from its dying body like a 400 mph tumor and HITS Cage's side. CAGE FIRES AGAIN, just as - - a SECOND javelin hits his FACEPLATE, it SHATTERS, the W SPINS, ARCS and Cage goes down, BLACKING OUT -

The LATE-AFTERNOON SUN streaks through TORN CLOUDS. SMOKE rises from the SCORCHED EARTH and BODIES of men, aliens, machines litter the terrain for miles. A landscape of hel Cage COUGHS, OPENS HIS EYES. He's lying on his back, RAIN drizzling on his unprotected face, his BLOOD mixing in the puddles beside him. YONABUR BODY and the DEAD MIMIC SCOUTS are scattered around. A LIVING MIMIC is nearby, scavenging through the dead, ea bits of other fallen mimic. It hasn't noticed Cage, until CLICKING and WHIRRING, YONABURU'S EXOJACKET goes into pow down, releasing him like an insect's carapace. His dead, naked-except-for-underwear BODY slops into the mud and bl The eater of the dead LOOKS UP. Interested. ANOTHER MIMIC stands behind it. Oh fuck. Here they come. CAGE STRUGGLES to lift his 20mm, CLICK. CLICK. Nothing. T MIMICS RUN THIS WAY. CLICK. CLICK. Cage SCREAMS - - SHUP! The mimic's body is TORN IN HALF - A FLASH of RED EXOJACKET as THE SECOND IS CUT DOWN. We barely see it hap Just pieces of mimic falling, and in two seconds it's ove Cage blinks up at... RITA VRATASKI.  10. Her crimson exojacket shines in the afternoon sun. Her go spattered faceplate hovers over Cage, then RETRACTS as sh grabs a canteen from her utility belt. Rita may be the greatest warrior on the planet, but she c be more than 23 years old. And she's beautiful. Storm clouds part, BLUE SKY beyond, but rain still drizzl She drinks, looking up at the sky.
When I grew up in Pennsylvania, they had a name for this.
For... what?
For when it's raining, but the sun is shining. Rita lifts Cage's head, giving him some water.
They said it was because the devil was beating his wife. (beat) Who comes up with this crap? Cage trembles, COUGHS, blood sputters out.
Am I... gonna make it?
No. I don't think so. But I'll stay with you until you die.
You don't have to... thank you, I -
I need your battery. It's fresh. Looks like you hardly used it. This sinks in.
(bitterly) Take it.
You sure about that?  11.
I don't deserve it. Rita gently pushes Cage over, unhooking something on his back. Cage grimaces in pain. He shivers, bloody, crying.
I... I don't want to die. Rita looks at him, a trace of painful softness in her fac
Dying's not that bad, once you get used to it. Distant EXPLOSIONS, moving closer. Rita grabs her axe, he jacket whining up to full power, her radio CRACKLES to li
I have to go. Good luck, soldier.

Fuck... off... Rita smiles, then heads off to the CLIFF'S EDGE, surveyin the Armageddon in progress far below. Cage's jacket goes into power-down, unhooking from his bo With the last of his strength, he CRAWLS to Yonaburu's si

(delirious) Yonaburu... I'm sorry... I... Yonaburu's one intact eye stares at him, blind and dead. SPLISH. SPLASH. Cage FREEZES. A MIMIC FOOT quietly steps into the mud by Cage's head. I standing right over him. This one is ODD, its armor plate and vesicles diffracting light in a OILY RAINBOW OF COLOR It LEANS IN CLOSE, SCANNING HIM. Cage TREMBLES, helpless. The thing's face is a HORRIBLE MAW - up close, it's no mo functional face than a black widow spider's hourglass is functional timepiece. A decorative WARNING to human prey. Detecting no threat from Cage, the mimic shifts focus to - RITA'S BACK. She's 20 yards away, too distracted by the battle to notice, as -  12. The mimic begins to VIBRATE, TINY BLACK TENDRILS exude fr every crevice of its armor, waving in the breeze. A FRESH JAVELIN forming in the center of its body, WHIRRING... And that's when Cage sees MRS. SMITH, Yonaburu's antique

Cage GRABS the pistol, aims right up into the belly of th mimic, SHUTS his eyes and SQUEEZES THE TRIGGER - BLAM! Now a mimic could usually take a .357 slug and shrug it o but Cage got it RIGHT BETWEEN THE PLATES. With a hellish SQUEAL, the mimic STAGGERS, the developing JAVELIN MISFIR TEARING a hunk of the mimic's body with it - - Cage fires AGAIN. And AGAIN. INNARDS SPILL - SILVER-BLACK TENDRILS like melted plastic, CRACKLING with electrical charge, DRIZZLE ONTO CAGE'S BODY, at 600 degre CAGE SCREAMS as it BURNS INTO HIM. There are probably wor deaths, but this one ranks way up there. It's HORRIBLE - - Cage's DEATH-SCREAM scales register, the sound going fl and weird, squelching out like a bad RADIO SIGNAL as - - the IMAGE SHUDDERS, FALLING APART, winking out like an tube TV, a high pitched WHINE, a BUZZ and -
- CAGE SITS UP, SCREAMING, slapping at his chest like he' trying to put out a fire.
He ROLLS off his bunk, FALLING to the floor, TEARING at h undershirt, revealing - HIS SKIN, perfectly intact, benea
What the fuck is wrong with you? YONABURU sits in his undershirt, cleaning MRS. SMITH, sta at Cage like he's crazy.
I was... it was... you were... Cage stares around like a trapped animal. SOLDIERS, the men and women we saw on the dropship, scatt around the barracks in various states of undress, stare b  13.
I, uh, I must have, uh... fallen asleep. Had a nightmare.
Didja piss yerself?

Check his diaper! There's a RECRUITMENT POSTER on Cage's wall: RITA VRATASK her crimson exojacket shining against blue sky, hair flyi a stern look on her face: "I WANT YOU! JOIN THE CLEANUP!" But someone - Cage, in fact - has defaced the poster to r "JOIN THE FUCK-UP, SUCKERS!" Little skulls around her fee NANCE, a tough-looking GIRL SOLDIER, burly as hell, leers
Maybe it was a wet dream. Maybe he was dreamin' about Rita.
Shut up, Nance. She blows him a kiss. Cage rubs his head, in mild shock.
Ow... GOD my head is killing me. I cannot drink like that anymore.
Like what?
Like last night.
We were here last night, dumbass. Liquor raid's tonight. Battle's tomorrow. Cage blinks, confused.
Oh. I... Right. I gotta, I think I gotta go puke.
Cage washes his face, taking two aspirin, hands shaking. looks in the mirror, trying to get a grip on himself -  14.
It was just a dream.

Cage walks back to his bunk in a daze, staring at the fac of the SOLDIERS he just watched get killed; some playing video games, some looking at porn, some working out, some asleep, half-dangling out of Mylar hammocks. - there's DAVIS, who didn't make it out of the DROPSHIP - - there's ROKER, who took a JAVELIN in the chest - - and YONABURU, hunkering over a map that looks like foot strategy. PALKA, a short Norwegian, tosses him WIRE CLIPP
Mission accomplished?
We have our exfiltration point. Palka circles a spot on the map.
Excellent. We'll strike at 2200. Griff, you're gonna be the decoy -
You think they got tequila?
‘Course they do. They're officers. They got everything.
Going to get DRUUNK... Yonaburu rolls up the map, hiding it. Cage frowns, worrie

Man, you ever feel like you're remembering something while it's happening, like it's already - (distracted) Hey, Ford! Can you not do that? SEVERAL SOLDIERS are GAMBLING between the bunks, heaps of goodies behind the WINNER, the LOSER throwing down his ca The dealer, FORD, scoops chips, smiling. He was missing t in the dropship... now he's not.  15.
Do what?
Sarge busted our asses ALL DAY yesterday in PT! You wanna put everyone through that again?

What're you talking about? Sarge's out all week gettin' his arm sewed back on! Besides, we got a lookout - - indicating a FAT SOLDIER, KIMMEL, up near the door, who attention is evenly divided between a HANDHELD VIDEO GAME HIS NOSE, which he is picking mightily.
Dude, he came RIGHT through that door, and — SLAP! SOMEONE SLAPS KIMMEL on the back of his head, sendi his game skittering across the floor. Cage's eyes go WIDE
Oh. Fuck.

Now just what in the got-damned fucking shit do we have here? SGT. FARELL is a living piece of leather; badly scarred, as piss. Everyone is terrified of him, even his superiors Soldiers SCRAMBLE to attention, but it's FAR TOO LATE -—

I'm gone for SIX WHOLE DAYS and my platoon, the platoon with MY good name on it, has TRANSMOGRIFIED into a veritable SHITSTORM of SHENANIGAN and INIQUITY! I. AM. APPALLED! Farell punctuates everything he says with VIOLENCE; a wel aimed KICK, a SLAP, a tipped-over FOOTLOCKER, as the sold FALL OVER EACH OTHER to come to ATTENTION -
You are ALL. IN. DEEPEST. SHIT.
SLAP! KICK! No one escapes his reach.  16.

And you will NOT. GET. OUT of this pigshit until you have EACH. AND. EVERY. ONE learned the life-giving power of FEAR and DISCIPLINE, the NECESSITY of ORDER and ETHIC if I have to personally KILL every SINGLE ONE of you embarrassing sacks of human waste and drag your DEAD and LIFELESS BODIES by the SHORTEST, CURLIEST HAIRS and throw you to the MIMIC HESSIANS! Two SOLDIERS exchange a look... did he just say "Hessians

DID you not think I would return? DID you not imagine that I would be wholly prepared to CASTRATE and MASTECTOMIZE each and every - Sgt. Farell stops short, seeing the GAMBLERS, who stand a attention... but their cards, chips are scattered everywh His face curls into a whole new level of acid rage.
(quietly) Oh. I see I've interrupted a game. A few GAMBLERS close their eyes, ready for certain death.
Tell me, Private Ford. Why do I hate gambling so much?
(trembling as he recites) Sir, because it's a game of chance, sir... because it entertains the notion that our... fate is in hands... other than our own... sir.
And what do I think about chance?
(reciting) "There is no chance. There is only choice. And choice is character. And character is fate."

That's RIGHT!  17. He SLAPS Ford anyway, for good measure. Silence. Farell s the terrified soldiers in hateful wonder. His voice drops to an almost tender register, as if he pi these poor pukes for the choices they have made this morn

Now I know that none of you exactly CHOSE to be here. I know that all the young ladies and gentlemen FIT for the International Marine Forces have long since been decimated by the MIMIC DISEASE, and that no sooner have you conscripts completed the most RUDIMENTARY training than you are to be thrown into what is GUARANTEED to be the Mother of all Battles: RUBY TUESDAY. (softly) We lost North America. We lost the Pacific. We lose this, we won't get to fight another. I would imagine the pressure... must be enormous. He scans their faces.
Ask me if I care. ASK ME IF I CARE,
Sir, do you -

head_text.subj: NO I DO NOT CARE. PT NOW NOW NOW

text: The soldiers HUSTLE OUT. Cage stares, STUNNED, as we CUT
A GLASSY TOWER looms above a SPRAWLING MILITARY BASE on a BAY. The base is the size of a city, but it's only part o what will be the largest military operation in human hist
It's called 'deja vu', man, which is French for been there, done that. Happens to everyone. FAR BELOW, the soldiers of C-Company run in loose formati  18.
FOREIGN BATTALIONS arrive, train - CHINESE REGIMENTS MARCH. RUSSIAN SOLDIERS BARK ORDERS. JAPANESE COMMANDOS SPAR IN EXOJACKETS. Cage looks around the field, sweating, dazed.
Dude, I knew everything he was gonna say. Every word.
EVERYONE knew what Sarge was gonna say! He always says that shit. C-COMPANY soldiers RUN, past JEERING COMPANIES of better behaved soldiers who aren't getting PT'ed to death.
I swear... this is different. It's like... I'm remembering things that haven't even happened yet.
Fine. You had a dream, we were in battle, and everyone died. Only the Valkyrie saved you - and then you died.
Yeah.
And the Sarge busting our asses out here, that was in your dream, too.
Yeah... I think it was.
OK then, Mr. Wizard. Tell me what happens next. Cage looks around the field, straining to remember.
Uhh... Kimmel's gonna pass out.  19. The fat Private STRUGGLES over an easy OBSTACLE, FARELL SCREAMING at him until... Kimmel FAINTS. MEDICS rush over
Well I coulda' seen that coming.

Yeah? Well, now... Nance and Ford over there, they're about to get in this big-ass fight... NANCE and FORD power over a wall, Nance taking the opportunity to GRAB Ford's ass. He KICKS her, they FALL I THE MUD. It's ON. SGT. FARELL starts yelling, SOLDIERS start running over, egging them on -
...and then Roker over there makes a perfect shot... ROKER hits three BULLS-EYES, HOOTS. Yonaburu frowns, spoo
...-and then Davis gets his leg stuck in the ropes... DAVIS swings over a rope obstacle, slips and ends up swin upside down, his leg tangled.
...and then Ford has to go to the infirmary after Nance busts his -
(scared) Shut UP, man, yer freakin' me out!
That's what I'm saying! Ford gets his teeth knocked out and then... Cage trails off, seeing that RITA has walked onto the fie trailed by her Dogs.
What the hell?

Holy fuck. It's Valkyrie One! Out of her jacket, Rita looks nothing like the amazon war you might expect. She's small. Delicate-looking.  20. Out of their jackets, the DOGS are, if anything, more menacing than on the field; muscled, tatted, scarred. The swagger in loose formation around Rita, true to their nam

(walking up) Damn. Looks like someone let the Full Metal Bitch outta her tower. Cage stares, bewildered. Soldiers gathered around the fig COME TO ATTENTION as RITA steps through - - and INTO THE FIGHT, where FORD swings at NANCE, missing leaving himself wide open. Nance SWINGS, her FIST coming SLOW MOTION, Ford's eyes WIDE, his nose: DOOMED -— - but RITA INTERCEPTS THE SHOT, catching Nance's fist wit audible SMACK. Ford staggers back. Everything STOPS.
How about you two save this for the battle? FORD muddily salutes. So does NANCE. So does SGT. FARELL.
Why are these soldiers in PT the day before battle, Sergeant?
3rd Platoon has a discipline problem, ma'am. I felt that a little physical exertion might help them grasp this important military concept.
I see. With a nod from Rita, one of the Dogs HITS THE DIRT, assu a board-like position: the ISO-PUSHUP.
Lt. Shep is demonstrating the iso- pushup. In Dog Company, we use it to practice discipline. The iso- pushup is the best training outside of a jacket you will get.
The whole PLATOON is in a PERFECT LINE, in a position tha could pass for torture; the ISO-PUSHUP. Not going up, not going down - just holding position.  21.

To control your exojackets you must control your body. To control your body, you must control your mind. SWEAT drips from soldiers' noses. It's hardest for the biggest ones. Yonaburu TREMBLES - and COLLAPSES.
Yonaburu struggles to get back up. Cage can't take his ey off Rita. Rita suddenly LOOKS THIS WAY. Shit. Here she co
This man's had enough.

Yes, ma'am. Yonaburu gets up. The lolling DOG SOLDIERS smirk. Rita DR assuming Yonaburu's place, next to Cage. Cage tries to ke his eyes on the ground, but finally, he looks - Sergeant-Major Rita Vrataski is looking Cage dead in the
(quietly) Do I have something on my face, Private?
Uh... No, ma'am.
Then I suggest you keep your eyes on the ground. Cage looks down, sweat dripping. OTHER SOLDIERS DROP, one one. Rita holds the position effortlessly. Cage is shakin He finally DROPS.
Cage GUZZLES, watching Rita, now the only one doing an is pushup, her DOGS cheering her on. Yonaburu SLAPS Cage on the back -
Damn. What'd she SAY to you, man?
Nothing, I -  22.
You really had me going there for a minute. I mean, you didn't dream about any of that, Rita comin' over and her talkin' to you 'n stuff... did you?
No. That wasn't... that's not what happened at all.
Good. I was starting to think you were crazy.
(troubled) Yeah. Me too.

UP FRONT, nervous-looking EXECUTIVE OFFICERS, pencil-push point to vidscreens, where MIMICS and BATTLE PLANS hover FLAGS showing armies of EVERY NATIONALITY cruise in towar the YUCATAN PENINSULA, while the island of CUBA - all of Caribbean, in fact - is SWARMED with GLOWING RED LINES th extend halfway around the globe; MIMIC FORCES.

The mimic are amassing on the island of Cuba, preparing for an all-out strike on the continent. When they reach a critical mass, they will attack. ON THE VIDSCREENS, whole CONTINENTS have been wiped clean human influence; NORTH AMERICA is gone, ANTARCTICA is gon Areas of CANADA appear to be DISEASED...

That's why we're striking them first. If we wait, we could lose South America. So this is what you'd call a, uh, critical juncture. IN BACK, soldiers from Cage's platoon pay limited attenti They're working on their own plans: tonight's liquor raid
You're still coming with us, right?  23.
I don't know, maybe -
Come on, man, it's ritual. C- Company ALWAYS gets drunk before they go into battle!
We've never been in a battle.
But that's how rituals get STARTED, wuss. We're in on the GROUND FLOOR. Cage can't exactly argue with this logic. As the meeting adjourns, Farell WAYLAYS them all at the door.
3rd Platoon, HOLD! Farell gives them all the bad-eye.

Now, Command doesn't let me ride your sorry asses past 1900 hours. But if any of you maggots have the spine and mettle to meet me in the sparring bay, I can offer in-jacket training. The soldiers guiltily file past. Not one takes him up on
ONE SOLDIER hands bottles of LIQUOR under the edge of the Mylar tenting while OTHERS keep a lookout. A CURIOUS MP shines his flashlight on the fence -

(hissing) Go! GO! But when the curious MP gets there he sees - NOTHING BUT EMPTY GRASS behind the club. We pan ALONG the fence, to where the last of the soldiers slip through the HOLE that Palka made this morning -  24.
DRUNK SOLDIERS run around in the breakers, hooting and laughing, total grab-ass. SEARCHLIGHTS span the beach nea
No, no no no no man, LOOK. I totally watched the whole thing - it's gonna be a cakewalk. SOLDIERS gather around, soaking wet and getting wasted. ROKER, with drunken authority, DRAWS A MAP THE SAND -
This is first division. This is 2nd, 84th - all the fuck of ‘em. They're all over. WE... (drawing) ».+.are gonna be right down here. Bringin' up the rear.
Maybe he uses a broken seashell to demark a spot, or a be bottle. One of the soldiers is totally naked, no explanat
Bringin' up the rear. That's funny.
It's a fuckin' CAKEWALK, man. We drew the lucky straw!
It's cos they know how bad we suck.

Same difference. Two soldiers try some version of a high-five, and FALL on their asses. SURF washes in, destroying the battlefield. CAGE sits off by himself, staring out at the breakers. Yonaburu staggers over, sits.
You're not still thinking about all that deja-bullshit are you?
Nah. Not really.
Good. Yonaburu offers cage a BOTTLE. Cage hesitates, DRINKS.  25. IN THE DISTANCE, we see the RED FLASHES of artillery. Low THUMPS echo across the water. BOMBING raids on the island
The soldiers of 3rd Platoon creep back into their barrack O.S. The sound of someone PUKING. Yonaburu is clutching a worn photo, too drunk to walk. Cage helps him to his bunk

.--when this battle's over, I'm gonna get my gold star and we're gonna have like fifteen fuckin' kids and live off of the Breedin' Credits... Yonaburu collapses into bed, dropping the picture. Cage p it up. A sorta-pretty girl. "I love you, Danny-boy".
Ain't she pretty?
Yeah, man, now get some sleep. Cage crawls up onto his rack. Lays there, staring at the poster of Rita in the gloom.
Hey, Cage?
Yeah?
In that dream you had, about the battle... you uh, never said exactly what happened to me. BEAT.
I... uh, think you got away.
Really?
Uh... Yeah.
Cool. Well I won't let the mimics get you this time, man. I swear.  26. Cage stares into the darkness, worried, and we CUT TO:

ALARMS BLEAT, RADIOS ECHO across the base, and everywhere STREAMS of SOLDIERS, millions of them, run to their deployments like ants. DROPSHIPS lift off in formation, HOVERCRAFT and MEGACARRI steam out of the bay, WAVES of STRIKEJETS BOOM THROUGH TH SOUND BARRIER, whisking off, faster than can be followed.

ROWS of EXOJACKETS line the walls as SOLDIERS pound in. E exojacket is custom fit, a soldier's name emblazoned on e SOME SOLDIERS look really excited to get in their jackets SOME look at theirs like they're iron maidens. Soldiers S to their underwear; exojackets need full body contact. GRIFF even strips off his underwear, OTHER SOLDIERS wince
Aw Griff no one wants to see that!
I gotta feel free, man! Yonaburu's jacket CLICKS into place around his body, seal his arm down to his fingertips. Exojackets are stronger t steel, and microjointed for maximum mobility.

Woooh, LORDY! Welcome to the Plastic Fantastic Death Machine! He KNOCKS his polycarbonate arm, THUK-THUK, for good meas KIMMEL struggles to wedge into his jacket, having managed gain another 13 pounds since his fitting.
Can someone, uh...
Suck in. Yonaburu and ANOTHER SOLDIER push... With a GROAN, Kimmel fairly POPS into his suit as it POWERS UP, encasing him.  27.
(looking up) OH FUUCK. CAGE steps around the corner. His jacket FESTOONED with e AMMO, GRENADES, and so many GUNS that he can barely walk. Soldiers LAUGH as we PUSH IN on Cage's ANXIOUS FACE.

CAGE looking, if anything, more terrified than before, DO BETWEEN HIS FEET as the BAY DOORS RETRACT, revealing - - CHOPPY SEAWATER flying by below. Cage SWALLOWS HARD. AC FROM CAGE, Griff is twitching, trying not to barf -
SIR yes SIR!
You spit up your jacket, yer in for a world a' shit.
You shit in your jacket, yer in for a world a' pain. Ford GRINS. This time, he's still got all his teeth.
Yo buddy, check it out. We got nothin' to worry about. I brought us life insurance. Mrs. Smith. Yonaburu taps MRS. SMITH against his faceplate. Cage's li begins to twitch. He squeezes his eyes shut.
.+.+READY FOR DROP... HOLDING, AND -— CAGE DOESN'T WAIT. He hits his RELEASE, and DROPS.
CAGE'S HYPERVENTILATING GASPS. YONABURU tumbles after -  28.
Cage LOOKS UP in time to see the dropship TAKE TWO HITS, FLAMING SOLDIERS falling as the ship begins its death-spi
- WHAM! BEAT. A GASP as Cage's lungs refill, he staggers wobbly, WET SAND falling from his face-plate -
THREE OTHER soldiers stagger up out of their own craters

Cage WAVES HIS ARMS frantically, which gives the doomed soldiers exactly enough time to LOOK UP before - - 20 TONS OF FLAMING DROPSHIP CRASH DOWN on them. Cage is THROWN BACK from the impact, landing in two feet of surf.

Cage nods, dazed. They RUN. EVERYTHING is exactly like it was before, with one major difference: instead of drizzling rain, there's a THICK FO CAGE AND YONABURU MAKE IT TO THE TRENCH, falling in with other terrified soldiers, FARELL screaming to TAC-COM -

head_text.subj: I NEED SOME GODDAMN AIR SUPPORT

text: GRIFF trembles, gripping his autocannon -
This isn't... It's like they fuckin' knew, man... it's like they KNEW! ON CAGE'S HEADS-UP, a RED DOT approaches the BLUE DOTS of company. Then MORE RED DOTS. EVEN MORE THAN LAST TIME.
We have to get out of here!
ROKER jumps up, ready to FIRE, when a MIMIC JAVELIN hits square in the chest, knocking him back - YONABURU stares down at the dead man, in shock, and sees - CAGE, ALREADY RUNNING AWAY.
Sgt. Farell SNARLS, lowers his 30mm cannon at Cage's BACK
WAIT! I'll get him back, sir! BLAM! A BLAST of FLAME and SAND as a mimic JAVELIN lands the TRENCH. Maybe Farell is dead, but there's no time to back. YONABURU RUNS AFTER CAGE -
- YONABURU TACKLES HIM and they GO DOWN, ROLLING. Cage WRIGGLES FREE, crawls away. YONABURU GRABS his ankle, MIMIC JAVELIN streaking past -
Yonaburu HEAVES CAGE BACK by the ankle - JUST LIKE BEFORE
TWO MIMIC JAVELIN streaking in -
- Cage TWISTS, KICKING YONABURU and KNOCKING him out of t LINE of FIRE - - a javelin NEATLY MISSING Yonaburu's head.
Why the FUCK'D YOU DO THAT?  30. Cage stares in wonder - SMILES.
I DID IT! I SAVED YoU! LAUGHING, like he broke a CURSE. But then Cage COUGHS. Something DARK spatters the inside of his faceplate. Yonaburu's expression turns to one of horror.
Oh buddy. Oh man. Yonaburu stares at Cage's chest. Cage looks down - THERE'S A 90MM HOLE CLEAN THROUGH HIS CHESTPLATE. Took ou enough spine that he didn't feel anything.

Oh god, I'm sorry, man, I'm really - Cage looks BACK AT THE TRENCHES where the rest of the pla are getting HAMBURGERED in the FOG - - and the distant flash of RED where RITA and the DOGS fi a SEA OF MIMIC TWO-LEGGERS. Cage's jacket starts to TWIST shake, it's gonna JITTERBUG - And then YONABURU'S whole head DISAPPEARS IN A PUFF OF RE The image SWIMS, the sound FUTZING like a lost HAM RADIO TRANSMISSION as Cage BLEEDS OUT, DYING - - the weird static rising to a BUZZY ROAR until we CUT TO
CAGE WAKES UP ON his BUNK, COUGHING AND HACKING AND GASPI falling out of bed with a YELL. Everyone STARES. Yonaburu scowls up from cleaning Mrs. Smith.
What the fuck is wrong with you?
Didja piss yerself? Cage stares around the barracks like a trapped animal.
Yonaburu. You, uh, gotta help me man, you gotta — (MORE )
(beat) Come with me. Now.
Cage explains, crying. Yonaburu frowns, listening.

.--and then, then I ran, I couldn't help it. I just had to, there wasn't... You don't know what it's like. There's gonna be thousands, I mean, hundreds of thousands of ‘em. (wiping his nose) And anyway, I did save you, for like a second. For just a second. MAN, my fuckin' head hurts. Cage messily shakes out some aspirin, chewing several.
I know it sounds crazy, but you gotta believe me. We have to get out of here or it's... Yonaburu looks at Cage with a mixture of pity and disgust His friend has totally cracked.
You do believe me, don't you?
Um, of course I do, man. (carefully) Let's, uh, get back in there, OK? And pretend like everything's all right. We, uh, really need to think this through, come up with a plan.
Thanks, buddy. You're the best.
SGT. FARELL is forcing to Ford to recite -
That's RIGHT!  32. Sgt. Farell SLAPS Ford, for good measure, and sees —
Now what the shit do we have here?
PRIVATE YONABURU and PRIVATE CAGE, SIR. WE WERE IN THE LATRINES.
You needin' COMPANIONSHIP? The pornvids ain't ENOUGH for you?
NO SIR, PRIVATE CAGE is SICK, GONE
Cage stares at Yonaburu, BETRAYED.
We're ALL Section Eight here, Private! Case of the WILLIES ain't enough to -

head_text.subj: HE'S CRAZY AS A SHITHOUSE RAT, SIR,

text: PRIVATE CAGE SAYS HE -—
You said you'd help me! Cage TACKLES Yonaburu. SOLDIERS HOOT, they love a good fi

head_text.subj: GOD DAMN IT, GET 'EM OFFA HIM

text: But not before Yonaburu, way the hell bigger than Cage, l a real proper PUNCH. Cage hits the floor, face first - Bleeding, disoriented, Cage is HAULED UP -
- and onto a GURNEY. His hands are ZIP-TIED. A NURSE dres his split eyebrow. A MEDIC shines a light in Cage's eyes.
And you say you're from the... future? But only... thirty-six hours?
Yeah, I think, I mean, no. It's not like that. (MORE)
It's just that I can SEE it. Everything that's gonna happen. But like I dreamed it. Before.
Ah. I see.
(trembling) We're all gonna die tomorrow.
Mmm-hmm. Well, you're gonna be right here on base, safe 'n sound, Private. We'll see to that. Nurse? The nurse hefts a sizeable HYPO-GUN to Cage's head.
Now you may feel a little pressure -

Wait... NO! Cage FREAKS, KNOCKING the hypo away from his head, the nu FIRES anyway and the needle PLANTS itself in - - the MEDIC'S ARM. The Medic's eyes glaze over like he's given an instant lobotomy. Cage twists, grabbing a BONE S
Now listen, don't... uh, don't screa -— The nurse SCREAMS at the top of her lungs. Cage saws the tie off his hands and backs out the door -
RUNNING, ass hanging out of the medical gown. More SCREAM
- where FAT COOKS make all manner of shitty food, and amo the STEAM and cookpots CAGE is hunkering, hiding, running

- CAGE RUNS out the back, dressed in someone else's cloth the base busy with TRUCKS and PEOPLE, he keeps his head l - PAST the TRAINING fields where his PLATOON is in PT -  34. - and OFF HIS SHOULDER, MPs are running out of the door, the NURSE pointing, but Cage is already - SLIPPING BEHIND THE OFFICERS' CLUB, distant ALARMS GOING as he finds the PIECE OF FENCE that PALKA cut for the liq raid. He SLIPS THROUGH, putting it back as best he can an

Cage HITS the beach at a LOPE, staying close to the cliff the guard towers can't see him, running until the base, t BAY FULL OF SHIPS, disappear behind him, and - - BEAUTIFUL WHITE SANDS extend in front. Blue skies above throws off his hat. Cage is free. AWOL, but free.
SEABIRDS CAW. A BEAUTIFUL LITTLE GIRL is playing in the s A SHADOW FALLS OVER HER. She looks up, scared - But it's Cage, smiling down at her, out of breath, sunbur
Hi there, little girl!
An OLD MAN in a STRAW HAT is fishing in the surf, wearing high boots. He waves, reeling line, coming this way.
Ain't hardly any more fish these days, but I want her to know how to do it. For when they come back. (eyeing Cage's bandage) You from the base?
Yeah. I mean, no. I was. I'm out.
(a funny look) Well it's a damn fine day to be out. The old man's fishing line WHIRRS, the pole YANKS. He sta reeling in line. A postcard-perfect scene...

Pretty!  35. The little girl POINTS. Cage FROWNS. The water at the girl's feet is covered in an iridescent, sickly SHEEN. A DEAD fish rolls in the oily surf. Cage instinctively picks her up, taking her to dry sand as - THE OLD MAN wades into the oily water, reeling in line to whatever it's snagged on. Something dark, moving, BIG... «++-A MIMIC AQUA-SCOUT RAISES ITSELF OUT OF THE WATER. The thing is segmented, 9' tall, too many eyes, water pou off of it. ANOTHER MIMIC rises BEHIND IT, EAGERLY INTERES
Cage looks back just in time to see the old man WHACKING the MIMIC with his fishing pole before he's CUT TO SHREDS Cage COVERS the little girl's eyes and RUNS.
But no one's around. The SPUT! SPUT! of mimic JAVELINS an THUK! The world GOES RED, at a BAD ANGLE. Cage is on the sand, looking up, grasping for the little girl -
R-run... He can't crawl to her because his LOWER HALF is six feet behind him. The MIMIC SCOUT advances, javelins BLOOMING across its body like flowers -
«..I'm sorry... The last thing Cage sees is her shoe in the sand. The gir SCREAM warbles, detuning into a weird DISTORTED HUM as th image ARTIFACTS, FALLING APART, BUZZING and we CUT TO:
Cage opens his eyes. Tears on his face.
Cage washes his hands, looking awful. The water whisks do the drain in the sink.  36.
Yonaburu is carefully cleaning Mrs. Smith when Cage walks eyes rimmed red, a faraway look on his face.
You OK, buddy?
Yeah. Can I see that for a minute?

No one touches Mrs. Smith but me. (smiling) Aw, man, I'm just pullin' yer leg. Yonaburu hands the pistol over, butt first. Cage takes the gun, chambering one of the bullets that Yonaburu has taken out and placed on a crate.
Hey, what are you -—

I'm really sorry, buddy. He puts the gun to his temple. We don't see it happen. We see the faces of EVERYONE IN T BARRACKS yelling NO and a terrible, distant THUMP and the - the YELLS detune, the image SHUDDERS APART and we CUT T
Cage opens his eyes. He doesn't move for a long time, jus listens to the sound of the barracks.
The water pours down the drain-hole in the sink. Cage sta at it. He cracks open a bottle of aspirin. Takes two.
YONABURU hunkers over the map of the liquor raid, marking locations with a sharpie. Cage stares at the poster of Rita. JOIN THE FUCKUP, SUCKE  37.
(frowning) Yonaburu, I got a question.
Shoot.
If today was your last day on Earth, what would you do?
I'd probably get good and drunk. Which, as it turns out, I was already planning on doing. Cage nods distantly.
You wanna get some breakfast?

No, I don't wanna "get some breakfast". I got strategic plans to make. Cage walks through the barracks, lost in thought, looking everyone who will be gone tomorrow: soldiers gambling, soldiers sleeping... KIMMEL, intent on his game. Cage exits just as SGT. FARELL ENTERS.
Cage walks down the hall, a semi-blissful look on his fac Farell's YELLS echoing through.
Now just what in the got-damned fucking shit do we have here?

Cage puts his cup at a machine emblazoned "METACOFFEE: BE EVEN THAN THE REAL THING!" The dank liquid sputters in. Cage eats alone, wincing over the bitter drink. RITA and her DOGS enter, Rita getting food, finding a pla to sit. She walks in perfect slow motion, gliding through world like nothing can touch her, her face expressionless  38. One of the DOGS looks this way, giving Cage a deadly look Cage looks away. Finishing, he dumps his tray.
Having a good day?
I've had worse. Mind if I borrow your pen? Cage writes "5" on the back of his hand.
What's that for?
I, uh, keep dying, and then waking up again. Figured I better start keeping track, you know? The girl smiles politely, afraid of this crazy person.
Would you happen to know where the holovid library is?
STARS, one billion of them, serenely float in the firmame of space, until - A SILVER, BULLET-LOOKING THING WHISKS PAST, at near light speed. Only it's not a bullet. It's... a MIMIC SEEDER.
I was only three years old when the mimic first got here. CAGE stands in the dark HOLOBAY, the seeder STREAKS past
They'd probably started heading this way a thousand years before I was even born. EIGHT MORE MIMIC SEEDERS follow suit, smoothly fanning ou into geostationary orbits above... the EARTH, at Cage's F
A LITTLE BOY and his FATHER stand on a dark hill, the lig of a CITY far below, the father pointing up.
My dad used to take me up on a hill and show me their satellites. I thought they were pretty. TINY SILVER SPECKS shine low in the sky. The boy stares.
AT THE UNITED NATIONS, POLITICIANS ARGUE under IMAGES of strange spheroids. MILITARY OFFICIALS scowl suspiciously.

We tried everything we could to communicate with them. IN LOW-EARTH ORBIT, A SPACE STATION revolves near a SEEDE ...the station SHOOTS a LASER at the seeder. After a beat EXPLODES. MILITARY OFFICIALS watching monitors CLAP... ...BUT THEN, in a slow-motion ballet, each of the remaini SPHEROIDS evenly FRAGMENTS into smaller pieces...

Then one day, they just dropped. .--and all the pieces DROP. The GENERALS' HAPPY FACES fil with dread, watching international reports stream in. ONE OF THEM lands on a CITY, OBLITERATING SEVERAL BUILDIN and landing DEEP IN THE EARTH - The images RACE FORWARD, Cage FAST-FORWARDING TO:
- A DAVID ATTENBOROUGH-TYPE pushes through RAINFOREST, le LOINCLOTHED TRIBESMEN.

They'd gotten down deep, and were showing up all over the place. They come to a HUGE EMPTY SPOT in the forest, the denuded Earth covered in an OIL-SLICK-LOOKING GOO, where THOUSAND PILLBUG-LIKE HALF-SPHERES work their way out in a circle.  40.
Everything they touched, died. A TRIBESMAN kicks one over. Hundreds of LEGS wave in the until he STABS it with a SPEAR, and we
TEEMING with the SILVER, BUG-LIKE THINGS. FAMILIES watch CLEANUP CREW comes in and starts EXTERMINATING the plague

Then they started mutating. An EARLY VERSION of a MIMIC raises itself out of the hole WALKING UPRIGHT - ROUGHLY HUMANOID. It SPRAYS the CLEANUP CREW with some kind of ACID. MAYHEM ensues, people SCREAMING, running every which way.
PLUMES of brownish SMOKE rise above ARCTIC ISLANDS, a U.D BOMBING RAID in process. The ground ERUPTS with MIMIC.

They always seemed to know where we would attack next, and the more we attacked them, the better they got. NEW KINDS of MIMIC INFANTRY pour out of holes in the eart like rudimentary versions of the human weaponry they are modeled on. Some SHOOT, some FLY. Some are FAST, some BIG

They fought like us. After a while, they even looked like us. Kind of. We see a SOLDIER cornered with a MIMIC, it GRABS the sold The soldier SCREAMS - - the mimic makes a SCREAMING SOUND back, the shifting PL on its horrible face MIMIC the soldier's EXPRESSION - Then the face COMES APART, turning to WHIRRING BLADES: SP
DOCTORS in a lab DISSECT a MIMIC TWO-LEGGER -  41.

Mimic had no brain, no signs of self-awareness or fear. Scientists claimed they were more like robots than living things. But they didn't look like robots and they didn't act like robots. - part of the mimic ANIMATES and with only a HALF of a bo KILLS the doctors, SMASHING the lab -

They acted more like zombie space killers from hell. The HALF-MIMIC closes in on the camera. It's made of LAYE like one of those Russian dolls with other dolls inside - BLACK and SILVER OOZING out around its one good EYE - It SMASHES the camera.
SWATHS of OCEAN have turned a weird, opalescent GREEN. WH CONTINENTS are turning a DEADLY GRAY... ORANGE CLOUDS PART, and far below, the JAGGED remains of FLORIDA PENINSULA jut into the rising ocean.

It wasn't until the Battle of Florida that things turned around. A MILLION-SOLDIER INTERNATIONAL FORCE fights the MIMIC HO on the CHARRED remains of DISNEYLAND, as - RITA VRATASKI, wearing an early STANDARD-ISSUE EXOJACKET, LEADS the HUMAN FORCES TO VICTORY, DECIMATING MIMIC.
She was only 19 years old. It was her first battle. She kills the LAST, her faceplate OFF, hair slick with sw LIFTED on the ARMS of her COMRADES -
CAMERAS FLASHING, Rita looking lost and alone.  42.

No one knew how she did it. When the press asked her how a nineteen- year-old girl who had never been in battle was suddenly able to kill four thousand mimic and turn the tide of the war, she simply said:
(nervously leaning to mic) I, uh... play a lot of video games.
CAGE, a be-zitted, lazy-looking TEEN on his stepfather's couch, powers down CHEETOS, watching the holovid of Rita.

When I was nineteen, I was still living on my stepfather's couch, staying up all night watching holovids and praying my service card would never come. Cage's STEPFATHER brings him a SHINY BLUE CARD. Cage star at his card, Cheeto dust on mouth, in shock -

But of course my card came. They always do. - while ON-SCREEN, Rita bows her head, receiving a MEDAL; ORDER OF THE VALKYRIE, the only one of its kind. She look out at the stadium, camera flashes flicking like stars. But she doesn't look very happy. Rita looks out at the STADIUM-SIZE CROWD, indifferent, as - - a single TEAR ROLLS DOWN HER CHEEK.
Rita's TEAR is COMMEMORATED IN RECRUITMENT POSTERS that decorate the CRUMBLING WALLS of the BURNED-OUT SUBURB. “JOIN THE CLEANUP!"
They were still calling it the cleanup, which was stupid because everyone knew it was all-out war. (MORE )
The Earth was dying, the weather was getting totally screwed up. It was them or us. CAGE is loaded onto a transport, with other young MEN and WOMEN who look just as shit-scared as he does.

An INCOMPREHENSIBLY LARGE MILITARY BASE covering the Yuca Peninsula. ARMED FORCES from all over the planet ARRIVING - and the SILVERY MIMIC HORDE covering the distant ISLAND enough to be visible from SPACE -
The Battle of Ruby Tuesday was going to be the big one. It was a gamble. Humanity was going all in. If we lost this one, there wouldn't be anyone left to fight another.
Cage gets off the truck, looking particularly out of plac the same look on his face as we
CAGE, sitting among a thousand SOLDIERS.

A lot of people were scared. But me, I'd actually been there. I knew exactly how it was going to go. STRATEGIC MAPS of tomorrow's battle hover in the darkness EXECUTIVE OFFICERS (XO's) point, highlighting the animate BATTALIONS that will be landing tomorrow.
I knew we were gonna lose.
...the main points of attack will be two miles north of this canyon here, where we expect the mimic to stage their front line. lst Corp. will be taking most of the heat. (MORE )
Your job will be to scoop up fleeing mimic infantry, prevent a breach here... or here. We'll be giving it all we've got, so -
I have a question, sir. The XOs SQUINT, interrupted. Their eyes adjust... CAGE is the only soldier among a thousand who is standing
Yes, Private? Cage coughs nervously.
Um... what if the mimic already know what we're planning? Wouldn't the breach point be more heavily defended than any other area?
Son, mimic don't work that way.
(whispered) - dude, sit the fuck down -

Uh, yeah, but if they did, C- Company'd get stuck between the cliffs and the canyon. And from that elevation, they'd, um, probably be able to make mincemeat of the advance dropship deployment before we even touch down. SGT. FARELL takes an interest.
Our intel says the mimic are massing north of the drop point.
What if the intel is wrong? The XOs look even more nervous. And irritated.
Son, we can't plan for every eventuality. (MORE )

C-Company and all the 81st will be one of the luckier divisions; it's a backup position. Now unless we have any other wild theories to entertain, this debriefing is ended. Good luck tomorrow, soldiers.
- teacher's fuckin' pet - The soldiers stand to file out, giving Cage not-cool look SGT. FARELL begins his spiel about in-jacket training.
Dude, what the fuck was that?
I just thought someone should say something.
Yeah, something totally insane. You still doing the liquor raid with us tonight or what?
Maybe next time.
Next time? Battle's tomorrow, dumbass.
I'm sure it'll be fun without me.
Man, what's wrong with you? You've been acting like a dick all DAY.
Told you he'd puss out.
Cage wanders the gloomy, empty locker room. At his locker, he stares in at his empty exojacket, "CAGE emblazoned on front, like a coffin with his own name on i SGT. FARELL appears.  46.
You asked some pretty good questions today, Private. Made the pencil pushers think. That took guts. Sign of a good soldier.
I'm not really a good soldier, sir. Farell sits, eyeing Cage in a new light.
You're really worried about tomorrow, ain't you?
Sarge, what if you were going into battle and you knew you were going to die? What if you were, like, certain with one hundred percent certainty? Farell thinks on this, taking the question seriously.

Then I wouldn't be afraid. (beat) That's what it takes to be a great soldier. Realize your doom and get on with it. Inflict the greatest damage you can on your enemy. And die a hero. Farell rubs his jaw, looking up at Cage's exojacket.
Come to think of it, Private, that is the perfect condition in which to enter any battlefield situation. Cage stares at his empty jacket, thinking.

You meet me in the sparring bay if you want a little practice with that thing. Farell exits. Cage looks at the "5" written on his hand. CAGE PUTS ON HIS JACKET. The LEGS bind, the ARMS seal, th CHEST closes, every slick moving polycarbonate plate whir into place, as SYSTEM CHECKS fill the faceplate. Cage picks up his AUTOCANNON and we CUT TO:  47.
Cage steps in, looking around. The bay is a vast, echoing space the size of an airplane hangar.

On the island of Okinawa, when the farmers were under the tyranny of the Samurai, they founded Karate on one simple principal: that the force of a blow was not in the muscle behind it but in the mind that could... let go of the body. (beat) Every muscle in the human body has a kind of control on it - something that tells it not to push too far, too fast. Keeps your body from tearing itself apart. (beat) When the Okinawans learned to let go of this control, they found that a human fist could puncture Samurai armor. And not suffer a scratch. He pulls out a chip, shuts a port.
