4:19? Damn. Would ya look at that. BRIGHT sunlight all around them, but THICK RAINDROPS fall

Yeah. Pretty cool, huh? They say that means that the devil is... (wincing) Ow! Cage blinks. He TWITCHES. Something's WRONG. The world BLINKS OUT and BACK like a transmission getting SEVERED. Cage CRINGES - STAGGERS.
It's... OW, FUCK! Cage's head. It HURTS. It's killing him.
You OK, buddy?
Something is... ARGH! Cage falls to his knees, his BATTLE-AXE clanging to the ground. He TEARS off his faceplate, holding his head.
Oh no. The IMAGE SHUDDERS, the SOUND WARBLING - - and for a MILLISECOND Cage is -

head_text.subj: BACK ON HIS BUNK IN THE BARRACKS, THRASHING -

text: (in the barracks) What the fuck is wrong with - Cage SPASMS again and - IS BACK ON THE BATTLEFIELD - on his KNEES.
- fuck is wrong with you?  73. Cage's face is WRENCHED in pain, he's helpless as more MI come streaming in, taking out SOLDIERS.
I'm sorry buddy, I - ARGH! Cage COLLAPSES, SPASMING, and everything goes TUNNEL-VISI
- WHAM! A MIMIC tackles Yonaburu, PULLING limbs off like you'd pull the legs off a fly - - CAGE lies on his back, helpless, dying, as the world BUZZES, SHUDDERS... and WINKS OUT.
Cage wakes up on his bunk, holding his head. He YELLS, ENRAGED, KICKING THE WALL.
Yonaburu scowls up.
What the fuck is wrong with you? Cage looks around the barracks, his lip twitching. A tric of BLOOD coming out of his nose. He wipes it away.
I die at 4:19. No matter what. 4:19 is when I died the first time. A horrible, sad realization coming over him.
It's just a loop. It doesn't matter what I do.
What are you talking about?
How could I have been so stupid? I really thought I could win.
Are you OK, man? Cage walks through the barracks, steps up on a footlocker  74.
Hey! Everybody listen up! NO REACTION. Cage GRABS Kimmel's video game and SMASHES i the floor. Everyone stares. Cage clears his throat.

Uh, good morning. I wanted to let you know that we're all going to die tomorrow. Or at least, most of us will. I definitely will. (beat) So you should think, like really think about how you're going to spend this day. The more you prepare yourself, the harder you try to be the best soldier you can ever be, the better you're going to do tomorrow, and for that matter, the better you're probably gonna feel about whatever happens. Yonaburu covers his eyes, painfully embarrassed.
I'm sorry to bum everyone out, but you gotta trust me on this one. This is probably your last chance to get it right. EVERYONE stares at Cage like he's crazy.
Oh, and Sergeant Farell got out of rehab early. He's coming down the hall right now. EVERYONE flies into action.
Cage is eating by himself. The rest of the platoon sits a another table, talking, glancing this way, clearly talkin about him. KIMMEL steps up, looking nervous.
Hey. I, uh... What you said back there meant a whole lot, man. The guy who can never fit into his suit is staring at Cag with a mixture of awe and adoration.

Ah... I was really just saying all that. Probably drank too much metacoffee. Cage sips, scowling at the taste. Kimmel sits, watching Cage pile all manner of salt, syrup and whatever on the grossest pile foods you've ever seen. It's disgusting.
Gotta keep it interesting, right? 75. spicy sauce, of mixed-up Cage eats. "214" is written on the back of his hand.
What's... that for?

It's the number of times I've seen you die. (wiping his mouth) It's OK, we all do. But you usually don't even make it through the drop. The main problem is that you're too fat. They shouldn't have let you in here. But they're out of fit soldiers. Kimmel wants to get up, but it's too late -

Don't feel bad about it. That guy Davis over there? He won't ever make it out of the drop ship. And Roker? He ends up on fire, cooked in his own jacket. How fucked up is that? And Ford, he always manages to lose one of his arms. Sometimes the left, sometimes the right. It's the weirdest thing. (beat) Nance, on the other hand, she just totally freaks around the second hour of battle. Starts killing everyone around her until we have to take her down.
Uh... I should probably go. Cage shakes his head, smiling, drinking more metacoffee.  76.
You, you usually just drown, after you run away. (chewing) I don't think drowning's all that bad, really. Kimmel looks like he's gonna be sick..
Uh... Why are you telling me this?

Because it's the one way I've figured to keep you from fighting tomorrow after that speech I gave. You're gonna get so freaked out that you're gonna take a Section Eight. The guys from the infirmary are coming in just now. You should get to know them. And in walk the INFIRMARY GUYS. Kimmel looks.

Cage rides, as in the opening, but his face is grim. He O his faceplate, pulling out a flask of WHISKEY, DRINKING i the HOWLING WIND while FARELL SCREAMS at him. He offers it to the rest of the PLATOON, they shake their heads, exchanging looks, and CAGE JUMPS, whiskey FLYING -

CAGE wanders the battlefield, surrounded by the dead and dying. His RADIO is going wild. He tunes it down, until a is silence, replaced with sweeping, sad music - maybe a string quartet version of Metallica's "NOTHING ELSE MATTE

Cage is filling a gulley full of mimics, wounding them ju enough so they can't climb out. He's clearly DRUNK. BARRELS of fuel oil dump into the ravine. The mimics are screeching to get out.  77. He lights a match to the bottle of whiskey and THROWS it, face LIT UP with the HELLISH GLOW. He looks TOTALLY INSANE.

Cage JUMPS from dropship to dropship, like Super Mario, climbing into the sky, way out over the ocean. At the hig one, he SWAN DIVES - - DOWN, DOWN INTO THE WATER. SPLASH! He turns, drifting d looking up at the dead and dying, the WAR MACHINES and MI and MEN hitting the water and floating down - Cage's PRESSURE METER going up and up until -

Cage RUNS at high speed, hauling a MIMIC up a hill, LEAPI - grabbing a STRIKEJET, HAULING the mimic bodily along, forcing the jet into a NEEDLE SHOT: straight up, ABOVE TH CLOUDS AND STORM -— - AND ABOVE THE ATMOSPHERE, where he can see the BLACK ED OF SPACE and the setting sun. The mimic ICES OVER and finally EXPLODES. Cage lets go of rocket, floating in low-earth orbit. IT'S BEAUTIFUL. His faceplate ices over, ALARMS going off. Cage opens his faceplate, THE VOID RUSHES IN, AND WE

BLAM! A little VIDEO-GAME FIGHTER EXPLODES in a comically violent way. GAME OVER. YOUR SCORE IS 943,943,925. RESTAR Cage wanders the field of battle, playing KIMMEL'S HAND-H VIDEO GAME, paying little attention to the battle at hand Whenever a mimic comes near, Cage DISPATCHES it without e looking up from the game. FINALLY one manages to make him drop the game, Cage gets ANGRY. He throws himself into a HORDE of mimics. CAGE is a DEATH DEALER, killing without purpose, rhyme or reason, standing on a GROWING PILE of dead mimic, but MOR and MORE COME, he'll be buried soon, when -  78. WHAM, a HUGE-ASS mimic slides into several pieces as - - RITA leaps into the fray, fighting alongside Cage. Cage matches her moves, swing for swing. Cage has never fought this close to her before. RITA lands, striking a pose. Her radio CRACKLES -
So. It's Cage, huh? Your jacket says you're a Private. You sure don't fight like a Private.
I play a lot of video games.
You're pretty good.
"Pretty good"? Cage FLIES into action, killing SIX MIMIC with one comple and insane ballet-like stroke, showing off for RITA.

Your one weakness is that you fight like nothing matters. Something always matters. She demonstrates. It's like her focus is always on what's next, like she doesn't really hate the mimic one way or another - there is a beauty, efficiency in it. Cage hammers a few mimics back. Clumsy by comparison.
I've tried to fight like you. I can't.
Try. Don't think about what's next. Forget about what just happened. She swings, effortlessly dispatching more.

You fight with your eyes. You've got to fight with your heart. Cage tries. The improvement is immediate. Mimic go flying they fight together. They are a perfect team.  79. Soon, Mimic litter the field. Smoke clears. Rita smiles.
Not too bad at all, private.
Well, thanks for the lesson. But I gotta go die now. Cage turns to leave. TWO MORE MIMIC head his way -
Private Cage, I've got a question. - SLASH! SLASH! Cage FLIPS, dispatching two at once.
How many loops is this for you? Cage TURNS, STUNNED. His axe falls, clattering to the gro
What did you just say? He stares at her, in total shock. Rita smiles.
I said how many - HEADS UP! A MEGAREAVER CHARGES, SWINGING its CUTTING ARM and - - the world BUZZES, falling apart, the IMAGE of Rita kill the Megareaver SHATTERING INTO FRAGMENTS as we -—

A picturesque FARMHOUSE on a hill. Waves of GRAIN shush i the morning breeze. Two HORSES nicker and prance by a bar and above, the sky is BRIGHT BLUE, hardly a cloud. RITA VRATASKI is lying on her bed, watching the sky, the horses. Rita's bed is in the middle of this wheat field. She sits up, rubbing the sleep out of her eyes. Looks lik she didn't sleep too well. With some regret, Rita taps a button and the horses FREEZ the grain STOPS WAVING. The HOLOVID IMAGE fades, revealin  80.

- the UDF MILITARY BASE, the OCEAN, and operations going below and out into the distance. NOW Rita BREWS COFFEE, carefully pouring steaming water o fresh grounds, yawning, in her pyjamas. The coffee brewed, she holds her cup like it's precious, looking out at the base... until a grating BUZZER goes of
Knock knock. LT. HOLSTROM, AKA CHIEF BREEDER, enters, clipboard in han
Good morning, Valkyrie One.

Hey CB. What've you got for me? Holstrom produces a HOLODISK. The room darkens, and now - STRATEGIC MAPS of the ISLAND, the BATTLE hover around the the ocean and the base still dimly visible through the gl Holstrom debriefs Rita. HILLS and TERRAIN and MIMIC CONCENTRATIONS spin and move. She takes it all in, drinki
Let me see the Sector Three ridge display again. CRAGGY PEAKS come into view, dotted with MILITARY SYMBOLS Holstrom watches Rita's face closely as she thinks. She focuses, mind going somewhere else.
They're probably going to hit the rear divisions. Here... and here...
TAC-COM ran the simulations and see a low probability of a rear attack -
Then tell them their simulations are wrong. (focusing) They'1l be in the mountains. Along this plateau. A lot of them... By late afternoon, they...  81. She trails off, frowning.
After that, I'm not... getting anything else. Now Holstrom frowns, worried. BEAT.
Nothing? What does that mean?
I don't know. It's probably nothing.
What should I tell command?
Tell them I'm taking a walk.
TAC-COM prefers it if you don't leave the tower the day before battle, ma'am.
I don't care what TAC-COM thinks.
except

memory Shasta CRIMSON EXOJACKET hangs, battered but battle-ready, for the leg, which is MESSILY OPEN - RILEY hunkers over the leg, removing the external unit, all pigtails, overalls, Coke-bottle glasses -
Morning, Shasta. How's it going? startles, dropping her glasses.
OH! Hi! I, uh, we're having some trouble with the anterior memory unit on V9, but I'm sure I'll have it fixed by this afternoon, if you -
I just came to see if you wanted to get some breakfast.  82. Shasta smiles, always rabbit-nervous, bites her lip.
I'd, uh, really love to, but I... I have to get this unit fixed before tomorrow. I knew I should have just ordered a fresh one.
Rita wanders, looking at Shasta's messy table, finding a cheap plastic figurine of... HERSELF. RITA, VALKYRIE ONE.
What's this?
(embarrassed) Just something I got off base. I, uh, think it's from New Taiwan. Rita picks up the figurine. There's a whole playset: AXE, JACKET, WEAPONRY...
God. The boobs are terrible! How would I ever fit in a jacket?
I know. It's kinda weird. I shouldn't have bought it.
No. It's cool. It's funny. Rita puts the figurine back on the shelf. She stares up at her empty exojacket, thinking.
I... wanted to say, that, if anything happens tomorrow, that you've been a great engineer. I couldn't do what I do without you.
Is everything OK?
I'm just feel a little weird today. That's all. Worried, Shasta watches her go.  83.
Rita walks, watching PLATOONS OF INFANTRY train. Her DOGS loose formation around her. An army photographer catches festooned with cameras, snapping pictures -

Give us a smile, Major. Come on. Big battle tomorrow, huh? How many mimics you think you're gonna kill? But Rita's focus is elsewhere. She notices CAGE'S PLATOON fucking up an obstacle course in every conceivable way.
What are they doing?
That's 3rd Platoon, 301st division. Conscripts. Never finished basic. They're the worst, ma'am.
Everyone gotta start somewhere.
NANCE and FORD power over a wall, Nance taking the opportunity to GRAB his ass. They FALL in the mud, kickin
NANCE AND FORD SQUARE OFF, a throng forming -

I think I'm gonna kill you, Fordy. Right now. Front'a everyone. They start SWINGING, just as - - RITA pushes through the HOOTING THRONG. NANCE lands a PERFECT PUNCH on FORD. He staggers, twists, and SWINGS BA Rita goes to catch his fist, but in a microsecond, notice - CAGE standing in the throng, watching HER instead of th fight. Rita hesitates... and still catches Ford's fist - - but the force of his blow THROWS them both around, his grazing her cheek just as she sends him SPRAWLING -  84. The Dogs step forward to intervene -
Hold it, Shep. Rita wipes blood off her lip. Offers her hand to Ford.
You got a good right hook, soldier.

The soldiers hold their ISO-PUSHUPS in a perfect line. Rita walks the line of soldiers, the PHOTOGRAPHER snappin pictures from a safe distance. A few of the Dogs hunker o the straining soldiers, GRINNING EVILLY at their torture.

A jacket can't protect you from a mimic. Only your mind can. The mind is the greatest weapon you have. In the end, it is your only weapon. One of the soldiers, CAGE, keeps staring at her. His expression very serious, almost angry. Beside Cage, Yonaburu COLLAPSES, struggling to get back u
This man's had enough.

Yes, ma'am. Yonaburu gets up, arms trembling. DOG SOLDIERS smirk. Rit notices Cage staring up at her again. She drops into a perfect iso-pushup, right next to Cage. she looks over, Cage is looking her dead in the eye.
Is there something on my face, soldier?
(quietly) You're a very difficult person to get to. It took me sixteen tries before I remembered how to do this one.  85.
Do I know you?
You don't recognize me?
I've never seen you before in my life, soldier. Cage frowns. He didn't expect that.
I need to talk to you. In private. Rita frowns, noticing that "329" is written on Cage's han
I'll make you a deal. If you can hold the position longer than me, you can say whatever you want.

Fine. THE SUN BEATS DOWN. One by one, soldiers drop, until only Cage and Rita are left. Two DOG soldiers keep time, shaking their heads. They've never seen Rita, or anyone else, hold an iso-pushup this long. A CROWD of SOLDIERS gather, gawking. Cage and Rita STRAIN to hold the position, sweat dripping
You... had enough...?
I don't... think so... But Cage can't take it anymore. With a YELL, he drops. Ri Dogs WHOOP -
Rita gets up, dusts her hands off. Looks down at Cage -
It's too bad. Now I wanna know what it was you had to say. But a deal's a deal.  86. Rita turns to walk away, surrounded by her celebrating me Yonaburu comes over, helping Cage up.
Damn, that was some crazy shit, man, I never — Cage PUSHES into the throng, after Rita.
In a millisecond, CAGE is on the dirt, two of the DOGS on of him, his wrists behind him. Cage spits dirt.
I got an answer to your question. Three hundred twenty-nine. Rita turns, frowning.
Three hundred twenty-nine what?
Days since we met. Times I've died. Times I've woken up again. Rita's eyes go WIDE.
What did you just say, private?
You said it was... You called it "the loop". Rita STARES, dumbstruck.
Let him go. EVERYONE stares. Even the Dogs look perplexed. Cage gets up, dusting himself off, giving one of the violent look.
Now you mind telling me just what the hell is going on? DOGS a  87.
Yonaburu DRINKS, staring across the field, to where Cage Rita WALK, trailed at a distance by the DOGS.
Dude. What do you think they're talkin' about?
No freakin' idea.
Rita walks in silence, face hard as stone, until they're away from the onlookers.
I guess you have a lot of questions. She looks at Cage's hand again. The numbers on it. Tears begin rolling down her face.
Are you, uh... OK?
Yeah. I just thought I was the only one it had ever happened to.
Are you... in the loop with me?
No. I got out.
There's a way out? Rita looks out through the fence at the ocean.
It was in the Battle of Florida. I'd lied about my age when I joined up. I didn't know the first thing about being a soldier.

head_text.subj: IN THE BATTLE OF FLORIDA, JACKETED INFANTRY FIGHT MIMIC B

text: THE THOUSAND. We fly over the battle, finding - - RITA'S PLATOON. She's clearly way too young to be here, keeping close to her Captain, LT. ARTHUR HENDRICKS, a goo looking, fatherly man in his late 30s -

We didn't have a chance in hell, but I was lucky, my Lieutenant was looking out for me. He kept me alive while everyone else in my Platoon got shredded. They FIGHT side by side - - but then LT. HENDRICKS goes DOWN, KILLED by a mimic wit

He died, trying to save me. I lost my head and went after the mimic that killed him. The YOUNG RITA HUNTS DOWN the MIMIC, enabled by REVENGE a FURY alone. Her EXOJACKET is TORN HALF AWAY when she fina KILLS the thing, using her PILEDRIVER -—
I killed it. And then I died. - SHE DIES, in the QUICKSILVER BLOOD of the ANTENNA MIMIC see the image fall apart, then RITA WAKES UP - IN HER BARRACKS, screaming, in her hammock. People STARE.
I woke up the day before the battle had even started. I thought I'd gone crazy. RITA wanders the barracks like a ghost -

I must have died twenty times before I pulled myself together and decided to stand and fight. ON THE BATTLEFIELD, RITA HAMMERS mimics with a REPEATER RIFLE, SNARLING as she is CUT DOWN in a SPRAY OF RED -  89.
After a while, I got better. We see LT. HENDRICKS die a VARIETY of DEATHS, RITA WEEPIN over some of them, FIGHTING through the rest.

I was in four hundred eleven battles before I figured out how to break out of the loop. ON THE FIELD OF BATTLE, Rita now fights with a BATTLEAXE - when she sees a RAINBOW MIMIC, the first one she killed just like the one Cage killed, streaking across the field Her eyes NARROW, she RUNS AFTER IT and we
CAGE'S FACE, desperate to know -
How?
The first time you died. Tell me exactly what happened.

I'd been hit. You were there. You took my battery. This... big mimic came up. Kinda... rainbow colored. It was going to shoot you in back. I killed it. It bled on me. I died. (beat) It was, uh, pretty awful.
Do you remember what it was doing, when it... when you died?
(frowning) Yeah. This... stuff was coming of it, like little wires. I've never seen one of them do that.
You killed an Antenna. While it was broadcasting. (MORE )
When you killed that mimic, you got tangled up in the signal. Became a receiver. Just like I did.
I... what? Rita smiles.
It's probably easier if I show you.

A SINGLE JACKETED HUMAN fights a MIMIC, we pull BACK, to SPY-SAT AERIAL VIEW of a BATTLE in PROGRESS. THOUSANDS of MIMIC flood across a field, engaging with THOUSANDS OF HUMANS, but we pull FARTHER BACK -

You ever wonder why the mimic almost always know where we're going to strike next? - until all that we can see are hundreds of thousands of and RED DOTS converging, dissolving, repeating, almost li mathematical equation, on abstracted, 3-D terrain. Rita's face is dimly illuminated in the holobay.
Look. BLUE DOTS head to a position... But RED DOTS get there fi
Do you see the pattern?
No.
Let me speed it up. NOW the battle scuds by at high speed, the mimics POUR on the human defense forces, like SAND settling, shifting -
Watch the movements.  gl. And a pattern emerges: ONE SMALL CHANGE, then... EVERYTHI flows in a new direction. Pulsing from RANDOM ACTION... t FOCUSED ORDER.
Now. Slow it down on that point. She scuds back and forth across a SHIFT, ZOOMING in...
The shift happens... each time an Antenna gets killed.
.--we zoom in to see a single MIMIC, getting killed by a single SOLDIER. But at that moment, the whole mimic strat like grains of sand at the wider zoom - abruptly SHIFTS.
When an Antenna dies, it sends out a message. To the receivers. One RED DOT winks out. But the BLUE dot finds itself surrounded... TRAPPED.

But the message travels backwards. Into the past. Nine red dots CONVERGE. The blue dot is EXTINGUISHED. The action REWINDS... the BLUE DOT moving back from the R DOT, until earlier, several RED DOTS move from their coho
It's a perfect strategy when you think about it. You don't have to outsmart an enemy if you always know what they're going to do next. Nine red dots CONVERGE. Again, the blue dot is EXTINGUISH
So... when I killed the Antenna and it bled on me... I became a receiver? And now I'm picking up messages from...
..-yourself, thirty-six hours from now. Like memories, but of the future. Every possible future will play out, until you break the loop.  92.
How?
We have to find the Antenna you killed. The one that bled on you. Before you killed it. Before it sent the broadcast.
And kill it?
We have to get the receivers too, or it won't work at all. But yeah. That's the idea. Cage nods, his head swimming.
That's it? That sounds almost easy.
It's not. They'll know we're coming. They'll do whatever they need to kill you every time. (beat) They know how important you are. Cage frowns.
What do you mean?

If you break the loop, the mimic won't be able to tell what happens next. (beat) You'll be able to win the battle. Cage's eyes go wide. Rita smiles. On the holovid, STREAMS and EDDIES of MIMIC overpower hum forces, over and over, in a constant loop...
The STARS are bright above, as Cage and Rita walk across base. The DOGS trail behind them, keeping their distance.  93.
I can't believe I'm really going to be free tomorrow.
(smiling) You'll still be in the UDF. ACROSS THE ROAD, OFFICERS enjoy final drinks at the PX. C can see the tail end of his PLATOON, sneaking around back
Yeah, but no more headaches, no more loop. I'll get my life back. Rita's expression goes distant.

Yeah. But I should warn you. I think being in the loop... did something to me. Sometimes I still pick up... fragments. Feelings, little things, the day before a battle. Like I can pretty much tell if someone's going to die. (beat) It's why I don't really talk to anyone the day before battle. They come to a crossroad; Rita's tower is one way, C-Comp barracks, the other.
You should get your sleep. It's going to be a pretty big day.
I was wondering - your lieutenant, the one who helped you. Were you ever able to save him? A terrible sadness crosses Rita's face.

No. (beat) I think there are some people you can't save, no matter what. Rita turns and walks away. From the shadows, a couple Dogs give Private Cage the las their suspicious looks and fall in line behind her.  94.
Yonaburu is slumped on the floor, drunk. Cage stares at Yonaburu, thinking about what Rita said.
Well, here he is Mr. Bigshot talking to the Valkyrie all day. She tell you how we're gonna win this thing?
Yeah. I think she did.

Good. Semper Fi, motherfuckers. Cage helps him up, Yonaburu mumbling, clutching his girlfriend's picture. It falls to the floor. Cage picks it up, looks at it. Thinking. Knowing he'll be free tomorrow. Knowing Yonaburu never will.

The dropship ROARS, STRAINING against the headwinds. DOG SOLDIERS & C-COMPANY stare at each other, while OUTSIDE - RITA AND CAGE CLING TO THE HULL. Rita pointing to the CLI teeming with MIMIC INFANTRY -
There. Do you see ‘em? The receivers, they're always a few rows back. You can tell by the movements. NINE RED DOTS on Cage's heads-up converge and divide.
I see ‘em.
Let's go. They JUMP. The DOGS follow.

MIMICS swarm the field, coming by LAND, SEA and AIR.  95. We slip between EXTREME CLOSE-UPS OF ACTION, of Cage and Rita's faces, to WIDE STRATEGIC VIEWS of battle, RED and flags dancing and spinning in the heads-ups.
There's a receiver. Flag it.
Got it. FIGHTING SOLDIERS STARE as Cage and Rita fight together, mobilizing the troops, JUMPING past ranks. Even Rita's DOGS can't keep up with them.
And another. You see it?
Yeah. As a team, they are UNSTOPPABLE. They complement each oth like perfect halves of a single fighting machine.
You're pretty good.
You keep saying that. Their eyes meet. Smiling. They DIVE in, Cage showing off Rita. They're DRIVING the mimic back, performing moves we never seen before. It's BEAUTIFUL, watching them fight.

There's two more. Cage and Rita fight like two people in love. The CLOUDS a starting to break, the SUN moving at high speed through t sky as the BATTLE PROGRESSES, CANYONS clear, MOUNTAINS cl - we find Cage and Rita again, at the forefront of SQUADS victorious SOLDIERS engaging the MIMIC in groups -
I think I see the Antenna. There. Three left, protecting something - A LARGE, SHINY MIMIC breaks cover, STREAKING through the RAIN, to the CLIFF where Cage died the first time.
We're almost out of time.  96.
We'll move fast. The last three RECEIVERS converge to protect the ANTENNA.

I've got these. Go for the lead. CAGE begins fighting the last RECEIVERS as - Rita LANDS in front of the ANTENNA MIMIC, its iridescent, rainbow-slick armor glistening in the AFTERNOON SUN. It pauses... and then RUNS. Rita CHASES, the thing deflec blows right and left. It's DAMN GOOD. FASTER than the res Every time Rita lets up, TINY BLACK TENDRILS exude from t mimic's armor. It's trying to BROADCAST -— Cage HAMMERS the last receivers, dodging and weaving, hac down ONE, then ANOTHER, while RITA and the ANTENNA FIGHT - it suddenly PUNCHES back, sending RITA FLYING, then JUM landing right over her.

Cage SPINS IN AIR, twisting down as the final RECEIVER fi multiple javelins, everything goes SLOW as his body moves just the right configuration to evade every one - - then he BRINGS his axe down. The last receiver is DEAD.

All clear. He sees the ANTENNA standing over RITA, tendrils waving - - and with a BATTLE CRY, Cage HURLS himself at the thing, in a blur of ARMOR, AXE and MIMIC - Cage stands in low battle stance. The ANTENNA MIMIC slides into six pieces. The pieces fizz crackling. Cage steps away from the boiling blood. It's over. Rita gets up.
I'm free. I'm really free.  97.

We still have to go win this thing. Cage opens his faceplate, Rita opens hers, feeling the ra Cage suddenly KISSES Rita. And then... she kisses him bac harder. BLUE SKY opens behind them, like her famous poste
You know what they used to call this? When it's raining and the sun is shining?
Yeah. You once told me. You said it's because the devil was beating his... OW. The weird BUZZ, the image SHUDDERS. Cage BLINKS, staggers, a SHARP PAIN in his skull.
Are you OK?
I, uh... there's something - BEHIND RITA, along the ridge, MIMIC LAUNCHERS begin to li the cliffs. Thousands of them. Behind Cage, too.
«+.GOT MASSIVE BUILDUP HERE... NEVER SEEN THIS BEFORE... TRAP... Cage turns. MIMIC are surrounding them, more arriving eve second. Rita's face falls.
Something's wrong, I... AIGH! A terrible PAIN stabs through Cage's head. He twitches, stumbles. He looks at Rita, horrified.
Cage?
I'm still in the loop. Cage SCREAMS IN PAIN as the IMAGE SHIFTS, FUTZES to -

head_text.subj: CAGE IS BACK ON HIS BUNK

text: - having a SEIZURE, people STARING, blurry, WINKING OUT a

head_text.subj: CAGE IS BACK ON THE BATTLEFIELD -

text: Rita's face buzzing back into view, only now she's CRYING cradling Cage's twitching body as he dies -
Cage! CAGE!
I... I don't think it worked. Cage's nose is bleeding.
I know. I'll stay with you. ALARMS are going off in her jacket, MORE and MORE MIMIC a surrounding the spot, by land and by air.
You have to... get out of here... Rita shakes her head. Their eyes meet. She's crying.
I'm sorry, Rita, I - But it's lost in a hail of MIMIC JAVELINS.
Cage opens his eyes. Yonaburu cleans Mrs. Smith. Making sure to get every cham really into it, proud of his work, until he notices - Cage, staring at the poster of RITA, tears on his face.
What the hell is wrong with you?
It didn't work. We did everything right, but it didn't work.
What are you talking about? Cage picks up a sharpie and writes 393 on his hand.
Yobo, I got a question. If you had to spend the rest of your life living the same day over and over again, forever, what would you do?
That's a weird fucking question, man. I dunno. Probably see my girl. Live happily ever after 'n stuff.
That's a pretty damn good idea.
(frowning) Did you just call me "Yobo"? Cage smiles, and we CUT TO:

Rita's glass tower glints in the morning light. The DOGS are assembled around the base of Rita's tower, having just finished breakfast. TWO of them are SCUFFLING for fun, while the others egg them on. One of them - picking his teeth with a bowie knife - look up, noticing - - CAGE, walking this way. HIGH-NOON STYLE.
You ain't got the clearance to be in here, kid.
I need to see Sergeant-Major Vrataski, now, and you need to get out of my way. The scufflers get up, eyeing Cage.
This a joke? 'Cos you 'bout to be in a world a' - Cage moves. WHAM! HEELER goes DOWN -

What the -  100. Cage TEARS into the Dogs like a MAN POSSESSED, fighting t ALL AT ONCE, eyes steady on the door to Rita's tower. The Dogs have been in battle 20, 30 times. Cage, almost 4 Even without his jacket, Cage is pretty much unstoppable. IN SECONDS, all the Dogs are on the ground.
Cage walks in, dusty, wiping blood off his lip, looking around. An EXECUTIVE OFFICER frowns up at him, and - - Rita comes out of nowhere, SWINGING.

But Rita ATTACKS, hyperfast. Cage can barely deflect her blows. She sends him CRASHING down, Cage spins, fights ba - but he's no match for her. In seconds, she's on top of hand on windpipe, fist cocked and ready to kill -
Who the hell are you? The DOGS rush in, ready for bear -
(gagging, bleeding) Don't. I'm... in the loop. I killed an Antenna. I'm like you. Rita...
What did you say?

My name's Billy Cage. I... I'm in the loop. You're... helping me. Rita sees... that 393 is written on Cage's hand. Rita's EYES GO WIDE - She lets go, jumping back like she touched a live wire. C starts COUGHING. The DOGS stare, totally confused. HOLSTROM walks in, cocking his gun, leveled at Cage.
Anyone wanna tell me just what the hell is going on here?  101. Cage slowly salutes, at attention.
Private... William Cage requests permission to speak with Sergeant- Major Vrataski. In private. Rita nods. Holstrom hesitates. Stands down.
They walk, Rita's mind racing, and tears on her face. The highly confused Dogs trailing well behind.
(wiping her eyes) Sorry. I'm just... used to being alone.
I know.
How'd you... figure it out?
I didn't. You told me. Last time. Before I died. Rita nods, wiping her nose.
We have to find the Antenna you killed. And the receivers. I can show you how.
You already did. She stops, looking him in the eye, suspicious.
Then why are you... here? Cage hesitates. He can't tell her the truth.
Because, uh... at the last minute, I didn't kill the Antenna. We... wanted to come back. Spend the day together, just one more time.  102.
Oh. I see. Rita eyes Cage, wondering just what she and this Private been doing, in his past, in her future.
You, uh, wanna get some breakfast?
3rd PLATOON is in the Cafeteria, grimacing over the chow.

I don't know! He was crying, then he just jumped up and took off like a bat outta hell. And whatever he said to the Sarge musta - (seeing) Sweet Jesus on a mountain. Cage and Rita enter the mess hall together, followed by t Dogs, who look just as confused as everyone else.

head_text.subj: CAGE AND RITA STAND IN LINE

text: The SERVERS try not to stare at them, lumping chow.
I'm sure not gonna miss the food. Rita doesn't know what to say. She looks nervous, like sh on her first date.
Table in the corner. Just like always. They sit.
This is weird. I feel like you must know everything about me.
Not really. I mostly know how to kill mimics. I'm pretty good at that. You said so yourself. Rita smiles uncomfortably. They eat.  103.
One thing I could never figure was - why do you come eat with us? No one in their right mind would eat this crap if they didn't have to.
I have to do something that makes me feel like myself. I kinda got used to it. Cage pours chocolate sauce over a pile of pickled eggs.
This is my favorite lately. "Pickled egg chocolate surprise". Cage digs in. Rita tries some. She smiles. Not bad.
Loop food. Brings back memories. What about... Rita piles hot sauce on top of her oatmeal, adding what l like canned sardines. Cage winces. She offers. He tries i
Not bad. Kinda... Smoky. Everyone is staring at them. Cage takes another bite, was it down with a big swig of metacoffee. Rita winces.
How do you drink that stuff?
Hasn't killed me yet. Their eyes meet. Rita suddenly starts laughing. Cage too. the anxious worry coming off of them. Now everyone is REA staring. Cage leans in -
You wanna get out of here?
RUMORS visibly SPREAD around base, SOLDIERS going out of their way to stare at the pair as they walk, the DOGS beh
(under his breath) Follow me.  104. Cage takes Rita's hand PULLS her around a corner, RUNNING
- down an alley, losing the Dogs, finding... THE HOLE IN FENCE, right where Palka always makes it.
Come on!
GULLS CAW, waves CRASH on the shore. Rita and Cage walk, stealing glances at each other. A sweet tension between t
So when we, uh, decided to not kill the Antenna, and come back, were we, like...
We, uh, just kissed. It all happened pretty fast. Rita pushes her hair back. No one's around.
I want to know what it was like.
Uh, OK. They kiss. Nervous and tender. It's possible that Rita's never kissed anyone before in her adult life.
That was... nice.
Yeah.
It was weird, too.
Yeah. I guess it must be. Rita looks out at the ocean, feeling complicated.
Why'd you join up?  105.
I got drafted. I tried everything I could to get out of it. And now... here I am. (beat) The last time... you told me you lied about your age to get in. Why?

I was sixteen. A farm girl. The town I grew up in, mimic scouts came up river, some hunters found them. They burned my town. I lost everything - my dad, my mom. My horse. (beat) I guess I joined the marines because I didn't want to live anymore. I figured if I could kill just one mimic, that would be enough and then I could die. I don't know what I was thinking. But I was lucky. There was this man. Lieutenant Arthur Hendricks. He found me. Showed me how to use my jacket.
Were you... in love with him? A painful look crosses her face.
I'm sorry, you just seem... really sad about it.
It's OK. Yeah. I'm pretty sure I was in love with him.
Rita trains with ARTHUR HENDRICKS. He's handsome, late-30 warmth in him, not undone by the years of battle. Then he's showing her pictures of his WIFE and CHILD. She looks at him like a girl in love.

I think he loved me too. But he had a family, so it was different... we never even talked about it. And besides, there was a war on.  106. WE SEE HER WINNING THE FINAL BATTLE, soldiers CHEERING in smoke while she WEEPS over the body of ARTHUR HENDRICKS -

No matter how I played it, I could never save him. He was the real hero of that battle. He died, and I got a medal. No one ever knew. - and then, ON A STAGE, getting the Valkyrie Medal of Hon draped around her neck. It means nothing to her.
Rita, sitting in the sand, the same expression on her fac She wipes away a tear.
When I finally got out of the loop, all I wanted was to get back in. To have one more chance to save him. (beat) I'd have traded the whole battle for it. Cage looks at her, not sure what to say.
I'm... really sorry. I think maybe some people are just fated.
Yeah. Maybe so. She looks at Cage.
Would you kiss me again?
Yeah. They lie back. On the distant shore, the low THUMP and GL of ARTILLERY hammering the far-off island, and we CUT TO:
Cage opens his eyes. The morning sky is bright blue overh He's in Rita's bed. And her bed - - appears to be in a WHEAT FIELD. Cage sits up, disorient  107.
Where are we?
Pennsylvania. The farm where I grew up. We had the bluest skies you've ever seen. (beat) It's just an old holovid. But I wanted you to see it.

It's really beautiful. Rita smiles, a little sadly, and gets up, in her pyjamas. The holovid FREEZES, distorts and fades, replaced by - - the thick polycarbonate glass of Rita's tower. Cage stares out at the island, the distant shelling, preparations for today's battle in progress, far below. A grinder WHIRS, water BOILS, GROUNDS go into a brewing p
What's that?
It's coffee. Real coffee. Some of the last in the world. She adds water, the dark brew drizzles into the pot.
I thought that stuff was extinct.

Almost. There's an island off the coast of Africa - one of the last places it'll grow. I fought there once and they still have it flown in for me. It doesn't seem right that I should have it all to myself. She pours some into his cup. Cage drinks. His eyes go wid
That's uh... nothing like the stuff they have in the mess hall.  108.
It's probably the best cup of coffee you can get in the whole world. I mean, since no one gets to make coffee anymore. You have to do it just right or it's no good.
You'll have to show me how sometime.
(sadly) I'd like that. Rita looks down at her coffee.
I was wondering. The last time we... were in the loop. You said we decided not to kill the Antenna?
Uh, no. But don't worry. We'll get out this time. She searches his face. She knows he's lying.
Well. I'm glad we decided to come back.

Me too. They kiss, holding each other. Cage looks out at the beautiful vista, smiling... but something is flying this WHAM! A MIMIC JAVELIN HITS THE TOWER. ANOTHER VOLLEY STREAKS IN - WHAM! WHAM! Cage and Rita are THROWN to the floor, her tower SHUDDERING with the impact The polycarbonate fractures, spider-thin cracks working t way across the room - but it HOLDS. Cage picks himself off the floor, stunned. ALARMS start going off. BELOW THEM, the BASE is getting HAMMERED by MIMIC JAVELINS - - SOLDIERS run like ants on an upended mound as MIMIC ERU beneath them, the beaches DARK with MIMIC crawling from t SEA - CARRIERS and DROPSHIPS engulfed in flame -  109.
What the hell?

The mimic are attacking early. They know we're together. (beat) We have to get out of here. Another JAVELIN hits the tower, pieces SHATTERING IN. Rit GRABS Cage and they PILE into the elevator, the tower SHUDDERING with multiple impacts.
They make it out, and to the ENGINEERING BAY. SHASTA is already there, with Rita's crimson exojacket ready -
(to Cage) We have to find the Antenna. We're not gonna get another chance. Can you make it to the armory?
I think so. Their eyes meet. Shasta notices the LOOK, and Cage TAKES

TOTAL MAYHEM. SGT. FARELL SCREAMS at 3rd Platoon as JAVEL TEAR HOLES in the roof of the locker room. SOME SOLDIERS make it to their jackets in time. SOME DON' YONABURU finds his jacket, but - WHAM! An EXPLOSION sends flying. He picks himself up, arm bleeding profusely - - his exojacket is WASTED. Fuck.
Runs through the disintegrating locker room, DIVING, JUMP through the carnage. He gets to his locker - it's DESTROY HIS FACE: All is lost.
Yonaburu, spattered in blood and dust, holds Cage's jacke
They got mine. But I saved yours.
Thanks, buddy. You're the best.
Go get ‘em.
Cage RUNS across the base, his heads-up a USELESS MESS of blue and red, the base in CHAOS -

Right here. THOOM! Rita lands, the DOGS with her. HUNDREDS OF MIMIC CONVERGING on this ONE SPOT. But Rita fights with TWO AXE cutting a SWATH - - and then THROWS an AXE to CAGE, he catches it just in t SWINGING just as the MIMIC reach him. SHUCK! The mimics F

HOLSTROM calls in STRIKEJETS. Rita SEIZES EXECUTIVE COMMA organizing the remaining HUMAN FORCES. Cage LEADS PLATOON Cornered, against impossible odds, EVERYONE fights at the best - better than their best. - FORD saves NANCE'S ASS, the two TEAMING UP - - the DOGS lay WASTE to everything in their path. SHEP is crushed. HEELER is blown in half. INU throws himself on a exploding MIMIC to save FOX. DANE ignites an AMMO DUMP, killing a hundred MIMIC at once - - SGT. FARELL finds himself fighting one-on-one. Just how likes it, WHANGING mimic with a twisted piece of metal.
- KIMMEL even commandeers a DROPSHIP, FLYING it into the HALL, DIVING and ROLLING FREE and watching the explosion.
STRIKEJETS hail holy hell on the ADVANCING MIMIC FORCES, the BASE is half-destroyed. It's not looking good.
fight their way onto a HEAP of smoking metal, getting a V of the war-torn base.
There. And there. Do you see them? NINE RED DOTS are flagged WHITE.
Nine of ‘em, check.

We don't have much time. Cage kills a RECEIVER - WHAM. RITA kills ANOTHER - WHAM. Their moves in perfect mirror images of each other. ONE, TWO, THREE mimic receivers go down. Everyone goes do different way. Each one is harder to kill than the last. The ANTENNA always WATCHING, RETREATING, HIDING - The last two receivers TAKE FLIGHT, Cage and Rita HUNT th down, merciless and unstoppable, finding themselves in -

head_text.subj: THE SMOLDERING CRATER OF THE MESS HALL

text: The RAINBOW-COLORED ANTENNA MIMIC SCUTTLING into the WRECKAGE. Rita HEAVES back a hunk of smoking DROPSHIP - - the ANTENNA MIMIC LEAPS, knocking her back, and is ON C in a FLASH. CAGE FIGHTS BACK, but this mimic knows his ev move. A SCREECHING BLUR of LIMBS and JAVELINS firing. Cage is KNOCKED BACK, WHAM! WHAM! BLOOD hits the inside o his PLATE as he GOES DOWN - As the blood beads and trickles off, Cage looks up at the spinning BARREL of the mimic's JAVELIN ARM. It's going to kill him now. WHACK! Rita hits it from the side. The ANTENNA flies thro the air in SLOW MOTION, tendrils FLARING -  112.
THOUSANDS OF MIMIC STOP ATTACKING. SOLDIERS are left scratching their heads as mimic DETACH, racing across the base to ONE POINT: to the MESS HALL CRATER -

- where the Antenna LANDS and LAUNCHES ITSELF at RITA, th BLOWS KEEPING THEM BOTH AIRBORNE until - It KICKS RITA'S FACEPLATE, SHATTERING IT. She SCREAMS, lo grip on her axe - RITA FALLS TO THE GROUND. The AXE falling nearby. JAVELIN pepper the area until a HUNK OF DROPSHIP FALLS ACROSS HER

head_text.subj: LEG, PINNING HER TO THE GROUND -

text: The MIMIC LANDS, standing over her, VIBRATING with POWER - its JAVELIN ARM leveled at Rita's unprotected face. She glares up at it, gritting her teeth.
An ELECTRICAL ARC ZAPS between the mimic and Rita, then t Antenna mimic... CHITTERS, the WHIRRING stops. Then it BACKS AWAY, looking for Cage -

- the MIMIC whirls, too late. WHAM! Cage's AXE swings, CU into the mimic, BLACK BLOOD FLYING, but it's not DEEP ENO The MIMIC SCREECHES, fighting back in a BLUR, but Cage BL its every strike. With no other option, the mimic starts SHUDDER, a tachyon charge building - - Cage SWINGS and the MIMIC falls, CRACKLING, SHORTING OU DEAD. Cage is on his knees, exhausted. ALARMS going off in Cage heads-up. THOUSANDS of mimic will be here any second. He goes to RITA, opening his faceplate.
Are you OK?  113.
Yeah. Get this thing off of me. Cage STRAINS, lifting the fallen piece of dropship and freeing her, helping her up.
Thanks. They KISS, urgently. The SUN is streaking down, RAIN, too

We don't have much time. You have to get out of here. Killing the Antenna... it doesn't work. We already tried it. I don't know why, but they're still coming. I don't think there's any way out for me. MIMIC have begun to line the rim of the crater. MORE arri every second.
I... I'm sorry I lied. I just wanted to be with you. It was the only way I knew how. (beat) I love you, Rita. Rita picks up her axe.
I love you, too. Rita SWINGS, hitting Cage with the flat of the axe - KNOC CAGE BACK 20 YARDS. He sits up, holding his jaw.
What the hell was that for?
I figured it out this morning. She walks towards Cage. He scrambles back. She looks up at the crater rim, her heads-up thick with o rushing mimic coming from every angle.
It's me. They're using me.
What?  114.
Whatever the loop did to me, it turned me into a receiver. She SWINGS her axe, Cage ROLLS -
As long as I'm alive, your loop won't end. Cage GRABS his AXE, DEFLECTING HER BLOW, backing away.
You have to kill me. Or you'll never be free.
Are you out of your mind?
I'm the last receiver. Rita HAMMERS Cage. Cage PARRIES, backing away.
I can't... I'm not gonna fight you.
Then you'll have to loop again until you get it through your thick skull. It's you they're after. You win the battle. Not me.
No!
I've watched you fight. I've seen what you can do. Cage KICKS her away. The edge of the crater is lined with MIMIC - but they don't attack - they wait.
I'm not gonna kill - AIGH! Cage staggers. His head. The image SHIFTS, BUZZING, like going to LOOP again. He YELLS, the world comes BACK -
It's the only way out.
No, I won't -  115.

You have to. But Rita gives him everything she's got. She's SWINGING a him, FORCING him to protect himself. Cage DEFLECTS blows best he can, BACKING, ROLLING AWAY. But Rita LEAPS — - and with a YELL, Cage RAISES HIS AXE, WARDING HER OFF,
- Cage's axe slices into Rita. She FALLS. Badly injured.
He throws his axe down. Runs to her. She pushes herself u over on her back. Blood gushing out of a gash in her side Cage cradles her.
You'll be... free now.
I can get you help. We can get out of this together - Rita shakes her head, coughs, smiling.
Dying's not that bad, once you get used to it.

Rita! The image DISTORTS, SPUTTERS one last time - and is NORMA The rain is coming down. The sun is shining. Cage stands, picking up Rita's axe, wiping his face. He l at the MIMIC HORDE. He raises the axe and RUNS into the h with a BATTLE CRY.
Rita was right. About everything. We see Cage's HEADS-UP, blinking RED, but as he fights we the onrushing FRONTS of mimic FRACTURE, EDDY as -
SOLDIERS UNDER ATTACK watch as SOME MIMIC start running i the wrong direction, OTHERS even start attacking each oth  116.

At first a few stopped working right. But pretty soon, they just fell apart. Farell watches as everywhere the mimic fall into CHAOS. S still attack, but the synchronous VOLLEYS, the ORDERED FR LINES are gone... From ordered WAVES, to SWARMS, to NOISE... The SKY is a HELLISH RED as CAGE CLEANS UP. The look in h eyes - insane with grief, exhaustion. He doesn't stop.
I kept fighting long after the battle was over.

In the EARLY MORNING LIGHT, the BASE is smoking, ruined. staggers through the wreckage. YONABURU and SEVERAL OFFIC trail Cage at a distance, afraid to come close. Cage's exojacket is blackened, dented. Cage finally drops axe, with a CLANG, and FALLS to his knees.
I don't even remember when they found me. PRELAP: TAPS begins to play.

A FUNERAL PROCESSION stretches out across the base. A MIL SOLDIERS watch, and PEOPLE across the WORLD watch as RITA FUNERAL BIER is marched across the ISLAND. ON A VAST STAGE, surrounded by COLONELS and MAJORS of eve stripe, Cage is awarded the Valkyrie Medal of Honor. The second person in history to receive this privilege.
We'd won the battle of Ruby Tuesday. I was a hero. Cage looks like the saddest person in the whole world.
But it didn't matter. Nothing did. Rita was gone.  117.
The BASE is still ruined, but full of living HUMANS diggi out, making repairs. BANDAGED SOLDIERS watch NEWSCASTS ab the BATTLE OF RUBY TUESDAY.
Cage's EXOJACKET stands in the center of a workshop. YONABURU, his ARM IN A SLING, is painting Cage's jacket BRIGHT BLUE, like you'd detail a car. He stands back, admiring his work. Cage steps in.
I like it.
I don't know, man. You're gonna make a pretty easy target. I was thinking we could put some flames on there -
No. I like the blue. (beat) I brought you something. Cage tosses Yonaburu his new medal. Yonaburu frowns.
(smiling) There's your gold star. Keep it.

Cage rides the elevator up into Rita's broken tower. He h to step past warning tape to get to her room. The spilled coffee. The bed just how they left it. He stands there, looking out at the clear blue sky. There's a knock. It's Shasta Riley. She salutes. Cage nod
Uh... hi there. They said you were up here again.
Hi Shasta.  118.
The morning of the battle, when Rita got her jacket, she, uh, wanted me to... to give you this. In case anything happened. She hands him an envelope. Cage frowns.
Thanks.
I miss her so much.
I do too. She nods and exits. Cage opens the envelope.
How to make the best cup of coffee in the world: Handwritten instructions. At the bottom of the instructio
I love you. Always fight with your heart.

Cage is pouring the boiling water over the grounds, follo the instructions. Cage drinks the coffee, staring out at the base. Distant ALARMS start going off. Cage frowns. Yonaburu com in, out of breath, he RAN here -
Cage. I thought I'd find you here. Alaska's under attack. We gotta move out. Cage nods, puts the coffee down. He smiles.
Right. Let's go win this thing. THE END.
